1.content:
1) Thulka Thudcrush, ogress barbarian - Standing seven and a half feet tall, with muscles that would make a very muscular thing feel not very muscular at all and a jaw that could bite through rocks (not that she'd eat rocks -- unless they happened to be those colorful rocks that anyone could mistake for fruit, honest mistake), Thulka is a terrifying sight. She's also quite beautiful, in a harsh, windswept sort of way, with skin like yellowed ivory, full, dark lips, and lustrous -- if crudely cut -- hair. Of course to really see these things, you'd have to get close to her, which means getting in range of her mighty mace, Head-Smasherizer, so most people are content to admire quietly, from a distance, through a telescope if possible. Thulka typically wears a fur tunic and loincloth and very little else, the better to show off her amazing abs and smokin' biceps.

2) Eilowyn Honeyridge, dwarven paladin - Almost as imposing as Thulka, and at only four feet, too -- but a pure and disciplined heart beats beneath her impressively large breastplate. Typically dressed in full plate draped with the tabard of the goddess Eola, she removes her helmet indoors, allowing her golden braids to hang almost to the floor. Courteous and kind, she nevertheless will not tolerate evil. Or yanking on her braids.

3) Snip Windfingers, halfling rogue - Slight of build, with tanned, freckled skin and curly auburn hair, this halfling lass prides herself on her ability to work through any lock or trap and get into any vault, no matter how tightly guarded. She's greedy in the extreme, and will do just about anything if the price is right. Usually wears black leather when she's "working", but she's just as often found in a simple peasant dress -- you don't want to walk around all day in clothes which say I AM A THIEF, after all, especially when the local lord is starting to wonder just where his spare ivory backscratcher has gotten to. She always has at least six knives hidden on her at all times, though.

4) Morissa Thorne, vampire elf necromancer - Just about pure evil, when Morissa's not guzzling blood from the local peasants, she's plotting how to lure more peasants to the area to replenish her stock. Her stark white skin stands out almost luminously against the blackness of her hair, her eyes, and her slinky black robes. Her weapon of choice is the Wand of Compulsion, which can force just about anybody to do just about anything.

5) Mifflemix Mistweeze Zipple, pixie mage - Only a foot high but bursting with magic, Miffle does her best to master the art of the arcane, but unfortunately she's got more enthusiasm than control -- or sense. She has light blue hair and antennae, as well as dragonfly wings, and is usually dressed in something made of leaves. Like all pixies, she has a massive sweet tooth.

11.content:
The barbarian came to the crossroads, astride her great riding ox, Enormerous -- for horses could not long bear her weight. Behind her was a path of pillage and destruction a hundred miles long. She turned her head and looked down the mountain at the burning fires. It had been a profitable week, and her packs and saddlebags bulged with treasure.

Her stomach growled tightly. She had eaten only light meals while on her rampage, preferring to stay quick on her feet, and now it was catching up to her -- although she could go for quite a while without food when she had to, she needed an absolutely enormous meal when the time came. She surveyed her options.

Down the hill she could see the tiled roofs of a quaint little human hamlet through the trees. Humans could be iffy -- they didn't tend to like ogres -- but they could always be counted on to have food on hand, and be willing to part with it in exchange for money. And she had LOTS of money.

On the other hand, the road winding off to the right bore the telltale signs of goblin passage. Goblins were less likely to have much to eat on hand, but they were easy to bully, and she could always roast a few of them up in a pinch.

Or she could just make camp here and have Enormerous for dinner. It wasn't like she'd never done it before. Technically, he was Enormerous the Fifth. And that was the fastest way to get something into her belly, which was loudly demanding meat.
11.title: Thulka Thudcrush

111.content:
Riding into the human village, Thulka rolled her eyes at the name. Vale Parish. It reeked of that human softness that made them the laughingstock of the ogres. What, exactly, was wrong with a town like Gnashbite? Nothing, in Thulka's opinion, far better than Vale Parish.

Still, she made her way towards the nearest inn, barging through the doorway.

Some humans started, an elf scowled, and an orc grunted a greeting.

A busty tavern wench appeared before Thulka, bowing. "Would the lady like a table?"

"Aye, I would, and bring me your most filling meal along with two mugs of ale."

Nodding, the wench soon had Thulka seated, the mugs coming fast. "Your meal will be our pot pie, made with the meats from sows, cows, and sheep all deep fried and wrapped in a thick crust."

"Sounds good," Thulka said, finishing her first mug in one mighty swig.

Belching mightily, Thulka downed the second just as swiftly.

"More ale, wench!"

The woman nodded, her blue eyes gleaming as she noticed a slight rounding of the orc's impressive muscles from the swift influx of calories.

This time, she grabbed five mugs, each one bigger than the last.

By the time Thulka finished them, she was only lightly buzzed, her pot pie coming shortly afterwards.

Digging her fingers in, she ate like a rabid wolf, hardly stopping to chew.

The wench watched all of this with her eyes gleaming and couldn't help but reach out a hand to rub that stuffed middle.

Thulka soon had the human's hand in her own and glared at the wench.

"I...I am sorry madame, it's just you're appetite is...appealing to me...."

Thulka observed the wench, noting her wide hips and big breasts, grunting in approval.

"You'll do for a quick lay. Give me a room and join me and I shall show you how much we ogres can really devour!"

The wench nodded, blushing as she felt Thulka's hand swat her rear.

"My name is Jalinda, madame."

"I am Thulka."

Several gasps went out at that and Thulka chortled. "I see you have heard of me. But enough talk. Procure me that room and more food this instant, human!"

Jalinda nodded and scurried to fulfill the famous ogre's command.

1111.content:
Thulka flopped down onto the soft mattress, feeling the stout wooden slats below creak under her weight.

"I hope that's comfy," Jalinda said coyly. "I suppose it's rather too short--"

With a growl of excitement, Thulka extended her legs and smashed the heavy wooden footboard into kindling. "Not anymore."

"My, aren't you, ah -- excited," Jalinda said.

"We ogres only have two things on our minds -- food, and sex."

"What about violence?"

"Okay, three things -- food, sex, and violence." Thulka grinned, displaying impressive teeth. "The more you satisfy our drive for one, the more the other one takes over. That's why we always rut on a full stomach."

"Eating makes you..." Jalinda blushed, "f-frisky?"

Thulka just snapped her teeth at her playfully, causing Jalinda to back up a little. "I-I see. Well, I'll just have to see what I can do to help things along, won't I?"

She wheeled a cart into the room laden with salty, savory-smelling inn food. Thulka practically salivated at the aroma of the vintage twice-congealed gravy, and the sizzling fat dripping from roast haunch of some-beast-or-other. Teasingly, Jalinda held the hunk of meat over her, lowering it to the barbarian's slavering mouth, and she ripped into it with gusto.

"Mmm. How are we feeling?" Jalinda asked after haunch had been gnawed down to the bone, the mountain of gravy-soaked biscuits had been devoured, and an entire jug of the inn's finest rotgut had been poured down Thulka's throat. In response, the ogre woman thumped her chest and let loose with a thunderous belch.

"Temptress wench," she half-muttered, half-moaned. "If my loins grow any hotter, I will snap your scrawny body into pieces when we proceed to the main course. Dispense with these appetizers, and get into this bed!"

Jalinda shook her head. "But I have the main course right here, madame. You should have asked."

She pulled a cloth off of the top of the cart, revealing a whole second layer even more loaded down with food. Thulka's eyes widened. In truth, though she hadn't been lying -- she was roasting with lust -- an ogress was not a bottomless pit, and after having a feast worthy of an ogre king hand-fed to her, she was glutted well past the point of discomfort.

"I tire of food," Thulka growled. "Pleasure me!"

"In good time," Jalinda said. "All in good time. I want you at your very best before we get to it."

She began unrolling a thick spool of sausages, dangling the end of the string in front of Thulka's face, and guided the first tube of spicy meat into her unresisting mouth. Ogres were creatures of habit, and if you put food near their mouths, they would usually eat it, even if stuffed to the gills.

Jalinda unspooled the links faster, feeding them into Thulka's mouth with one hand and rubbing her throat with the other. The ogress scarcely dared moved for fear she would choke.

Finally, the sausages stopped. "Enough!" Thulka roared. "No more!" She attempted to sit up, intent on dragging this troublesome tart down into the bed and giving her a taste of her own medicine, but a queasy jolt of pain stopped her. Her stomach was so distended that she couldn't even bend at the waist -- and she was drunk. Really drunk. The room was spinning around her.

"Just a little more," Jalinda squealed in ecstasy. "You're just about done!" She uncorked a bottle of wine and shoved it roughly into Thulka's mouth. Thulka felt shudders of nausea twisting her insides as the contents of the bottle joined over a gallon of assorted ales and more food than she even wanted to think about.

"N-ugh--uggle!" Thulka choked on the foamy liquid. Then the combined forces of drunkenness and severe overindulgence collapsed on her, and she passed out.

The next morning, a still very bloated -- and still annoyingly horny -- Thulka awoke to find...
1111.title: Ogre-Indulgence

11111.content:
The room was packed full of soldiers, all with swords and halberds pointed at her. These guys didn't look like they were just town guard. Their armor was a cut above the rest, and their leader seemed to just positively drip with the kind of full-of-himself authority Thulka loved to watch vanish from people's faces, shortly before she made their faces vanish with her hammer. Determined to go down fighting despite her nudity, she tried to leap from the bed only to find that two things were keeping her. Her hands and legs were shackled together and fastened to the bed, and her gut was still bloated and swollen from the sheer amount of food that strumpet shoveled into her yesterday. And she could see her now, with a nice, fat bag of gold, leaving the room hurriedly. The lead soldier opened up a parchment, cleared his throat, and began to read.

"Thulka Thudcrush, alias Thulka the Thunderous, alias Thulk Smash, alias The Thulkster, The Tavern Terror, alias the Whorenihillator, alias Ol' Dirty Bitch. You have committed crimes against the kingdom, including but not limited to murder, rape, theft, blasphemy, arson, destruction of property both private and public, poaching, public indecency, tax evasion, and tethering an animal in an illegal spot."

"Those charges are trumped up! I've never illegally parked Enormerous in my life! Come closer, so I can crush your skull between my thighs!"

The captain ignored her and continued on. "For these crimes, you have been sentenced to death. However, the Baron of these lands has pleaded for lenience in your case. In exchange for your freedom, you are to perform a task for him. You are to slay a giant clan that has taken up residence near his castle, and rescue his daughter. Fifty percent of loot and pillage found in this venture is yours, but you will be accompanied by a kingdom-appointed wizard and have... Safeguards put on you, to make sure you don't get any funny ideas about running away."

As if on cue, a rather scrawny young man in a pointed hat and tattered robes shuffled sheepishly out of the thicket of blades, clutching a spellbook for dear life. He looked at the ogress nervously at first, and then a little bit appreciatively after he realized she was naked. Thulka roared at him, thrashing her chains angrily, making the bed creak and splinter a bit with her rage. Backing up with a yelp, the wizard retreated only to find himself being guided back to the ogress with a sword at his back. "And don't think the Baron's forgotten about what YOU'VE done, Abernathy. Get casting. The sooner this farce is done with, the better." The barbarian couldn't help but chuckle as the wizard grumbled, timidly approaching her with his wand pulled out.

"That's not going to be big enough." She mocked him with a kissy face, causing him to blush bright red. The wand traced a sigil of putrescent green around her navel, and the mage finished off by tapping seven times on her drum taut stomach, eliciting a loud belch from Thulka. "Fames Gastros!" He then went to the shackles, enchanting them somehow. "Catenas Placis!" Thulka snorted. To put things succinctly, she wasn't much a fan of magic. Fancy words and hand waving... Ridiculous! But also dangerous. What did this runt just do to her?

Suddenly, they began to undo her shackles. Well, they began to undo the chains of her shackles, anyway, leaving the wrist and leg bindings on. A foolish mistake on their part. Even stodged full of food and booze, she was still a force to be reckoned with. Springing off of the bed with a leap, she moved to bring her fist smashing into the wizard's face, eliciting the most pleasantly girlish scream from him... When suddenly, mere inches from knocking his teeth in, her fist stopped.

"...Huh?"

And then the hunger hit. She groaned in pain as her stomach seemed to clench with hunger despite being nearly full. Her arms went to her belly, trying to massage the pain away, but it had no real effect. Then she saw the wizard timidly touch her stomach, and the pain seemed to go away... Though the hunger was still there. Diminished, but there.

"What do you DO to me, shrimp?!"

Abernathy mumbled and stuttered a bit before the captain stepped in. "Merely something to keep you... Reined in. The shackles have been enchanted to keep you from doing violence to anyone, unless directed to by a representative of the Baron or the lad here. The mark's something to keep you from running away. Unless Abernathy touches his wand to your stomach once every day in the morning, or if you try to hurt anyone besides those you're SUPPOSED to, it'll trigger. I believe you already know what it does. Even if you manage to evade patrols while rubbing your poor widdle tummy, good luck trying to forage enough food to keep yourself from going mad."

The soldiers filed out of the room, and as the captain reached the door, he turned around for a moment and threw a rolled-up parchment at the bed. "Details about your mission are on there. Oh. And don't think the wizard will help you escape. He has his own reasons for complying."

With that, it was just Thulka and Abernathy. Shuffling a bit, the magic user looked down. "Um. Sorry?"

"Just shut up and turn around so I can get dressed."

Abernathy yelped. "R-right!" He said. He closed his eyes and began to chant again. "Fawq fu jnuhi, ygi fu bved, mninko fu hyg- wait, no- ctyfin qhi!"

The light between Abernathy's outstretched hands had been glowing red, but the instant he stumbled over his words, it switched to purple. The purple beam of light shot into Fáthach, causing a huge explosion of dust. Thulka began laughing.

"I didn't know you had it in you to kill her, human!" She managed to get out between guffaws. Abernathy, meanwhile, was shocked.

"N-no," he stammered out. "She- she wasn't supposed to die! That w-was a strength enhancing spell!"

Both Thulka's laughter and Abernathy's terrified mumbling were cut off by groaning from the dust cloud.

"Abernathy, I do not think your spell worked," Fáthach's voice said. To both Abernathy's and Thulka's shock, the giant- or rather, former giant- was fine. She was just, well, not a giant anymore. She was at around Abernathy's height, but probably weighed three times more than Thulka, her grass-green skin stretched over a belly that was larger than she was tall!

"Nevertheless, I got what I wanted," Fáthach finished. She rubbed her distended belly with a mix of content and longing. "I always wanted to know how it was like to be this fat as the size of a human. You have my gratitude. I shall help you on your quest."

Jalinda was next to her, a wide grin on her face.

"Satisfy me wench!"

Jalinda giggled and rubbed Thulka's still bloated gut.

Thulka let loose a belch and started to pant as Jalinda moved her hand lower.

"First things first, let me travel with you, be your sword and your comfort on the long road. If you agree to this, I'll pleasure you as much as you want."

It was going to a fun adventure...
11112.title: The New Sidekick

111122.content:
From high atop a hilltop, a grizzled man in a brown cloak watched the road below. Pickings had been slim, recently -- merchant caravans were either heavily guarded or had nothing worth stealing, and few travelers came along the road alone these days.

He smirked. Maybe because of all those rumors about bandits robbing people blind and slitting their throats? Being a bandit was a little like being a dog begging for scraps -- you had to know when to move on before you got a boot to the flank.

Just then, he spotted something. Two travelers, alone? It was too good to be true. One of them was a rosy-cheeked, cornfed blonde, so short she would have been pixiesh if not for her impressive curves, riding along on a dappled pony without a care in the world. The other --

Ah. So it was too good to be true then. The other was a massive ogre warmaiden, bulging with muscle, steely eyes glinting from under shaggy black bangs. Definitely not the sort of person you wanted to mess with.

Still, he had almost fifteen men and women sitting around doing nothing and growing increasingly restless, and restless bandits spelled bad news for a bandit leader. And they did have the element of surprise.

He whistled, too-wheet, too-wheet, the song of the finchhawk. A signal.

Marks below - attack at will!

Thulka stiffened and stopped, swiftly grabbing Jalinda's reins as well and moving her behind her. Arrows rained from above and one slashed across Jalinda's shoulder while another buried itself in Thulka's shoulder. Grunting, the ogress removed the arrow and roared, her canines extending. Charging the bandits that were now approaching on horseback, she let fly her first return arrow, the shaft flying true and burying itself in a woman's eye.

Unsheathing her axe, she began a massacre, ignoring any wounds she received and countering with fatal blows.

In the span of ten minutes, all of the bandits were dead, save for the leader who was choking on his lifeblood.

Getting off her horse, Thulka approached and lifted the dying man up. Teeth flashing, she ripped out his throat and spat the chunk of flesh from her mouth, swiftly returning to Jalinda and roughly bandaging her wound.

"Thank you-"

"Do not thank me, you are my mate and mates do not thank one another. They pleasure one another so gather me some food, feed me, and fuck me!"

Jalinda shivered at the command and nodded, a thrill coursing through her.

11112212.content:
"Ahhh," Thulka grinned, displaying her powerful canines. "For a human, you're not half-bad with those twiggy little fingers of yours."

"Mmm," Jalinda purred. The two of them had curled up together on one of the blankets at the now-abandoned bandit camp. "I bet you've worked up an appetite. And just look at all this food that those bandits won't be needing anymore! Shame to let it go to waste."

"I think I know what you've got in mind," Thulka said. "Very well, wench, gather up enough food for breakfast. But mind you don't get too ambitious about what one stomach can hold! It's no fun riding when you're glutted."

"Oh, I'll be careful," Jalinda nodded, snickering. She turned and began digging through the bandit's stores. Apples, oranges, bread and jars of preserves, salted meat...

By the time she was finished, practically every bit of food in the camp had been piled in front of Thulka. The ogress raised an eyebrow skeptically. "Are you sure about this?"

"Oh, yes!"

"You don't think that's too much."

"Just a snack!" Jalinda wheedled sincerely.

"If you say so, barmaid." Thulka shrugged. "Well, dig in."

Jalinda's face fell. "Me?"

Thulka grinned so broadly her entire bear-trap set of teeth was on display. "Oh, didn't I mention you were gathering your own breakfast? Good thing you didn't overdo it."

Jalinda looked pale. "B-b-but I... maybe I did... overestimate just a bit..."

Thulka put one massive arm around the nervous barmaid and guided to a seat in front of the pile. "I'm sure you'll manage."

"I ... I don't know if I can--"

"You'd better!" Thulka roared. "After what you did to me in the inn? This is revenge, wench! Start feeding your face, or I'll take it out of your hide!"

Jalinda gulped and picked up the first apple.

-----------

Two hours later, the blanket contained one highly amused ogress, one much smaller pile, and one very sorry barmaid who was stuffed up to her eyeballs.

"Another sausage, wench?"

"I can't!" Jalinda wailed. "Please don't make me! I'll pop!"

Thulka smirked. "Very well. I guess you've learned your lesson." She slipped her finger under the front of Jalinda's unlaced jerkin, rubbing her calloused hand over the taut bulge. The poor girl groaned.

"Enough dawdling! Back on the road!"

Jalinda belched. "I don't think I can ride. I don't think I can move!"

"Then we'll just have to think of something to do in the meantime, won't we?" Thulka said, unlacing the jerkin the rest of the way and laying the barmaid's torso as bare as a stuffed turkey. "I've got a couple of ideas."

Jalinda quivered. I can't say I enjoyed breakfast... but I think I'm going to like dessert!
11112212.title: Best Served Cold

Jalinda and Thulka adjust to their changed forms.
111122122.content:
Thulka toyed with her mate's stuffed middle, poking and prodding until Jalinda's mouth was unleashing a symphony of belches, before the ogress shoved a few more sausage links into Jalinda's mouth.

Jalinda whimpered as she felt her stuffed stomach puff out just that much more, her eyes starting to roll back a bit at how totally stuffed she was.

Thulka snorted in approval and brought out her hunting knife. A cut to her own flesh was followed by a cut to Jalinda's arm, Thulka bringing the bloody wound towards her mouth and her own wound going towards Jalinda's mouth.

"Drink with me and we shall be bound for eternity."

Jalinda found her mouth opening before she could fully register it and the taste of her mate's earthy blood filled her completely, her stomach churning as her body started to change a bit. Her skin became the greenish-greyish mixture common in an ogres but with traces of her old human skin tone still present. Her nose ballooned a bit, soon matching Thulka's in size, her body softening yet increasing in size.

Watching her ogress of a mate, Jalinda was surprised to see Thulka gaining some human traits, a bit of a lighter skin tone and a gleam of greater empathy in her eyes. Other than that, she looked the same and the smirk she wore was identical to the one she had before she started this ritual.

"Now, my precious mate, more food?"

Jalinda opened her mouth, feeling her odd hybrid ogre/human teeth and took in the many scents her new nose could pick up, her soft belly rumbling.

"Yes, Thulka, more food and then we fuck!"

Thulka nodded, hugging Jalinda close.

She had certainly made the right choice in a mate.
111122122.title: Thulka decides the punishment isn't quite o...

A heavily-guarded fortress.
1111221221.content:
"So what exactly did you do to me back there?" Jalinda muttered into Thulka's ear. The two of them road astride Enormerous -- Jalinda's weight would quickly exhaust her little pony, so they were using the horse to carry a lighter load of supplies while both women rode together.

"The Bond of Kings," Thulka explains. "It's an ancient rite used by the leaders of the Four Holds, from the days when ogres ruled over humans in the north. Leaders would use it to reward especially powerful and loyal vassels with a measure of ogrish might." She grinned, displaying her canines. "Of course, it also binds you to me."

"Oh, I bet you do this with all the girls," Jalinda teased.

"As a matter of fact, you're the first," Thulka said. "I've only seen it performed a handful of times, and it didn't quite turn out how I expected, this time."

"Oh, really?"

"All the other times, the ritual made the human stronger. Fitter. You, on the other hand, just got fat."

"Hey! So I'm bigger-boned..."

"Yes, and fatter too." Thulka grinned. "Looks like it makes you more of what you already are. Muscular humans get more muscular, while cream puffs get creamier, and puffier. I'm not complaining, mind. I like my wenches with a little meat on 'em."

"You just wait, my love," Jalinda murmured, running her hand across Thulka's rock-hard abdominal muscles. "I like my wenches with a lot of meat on them." Her fingers squeezed together, attempting to pinch an inch that wasn't there.

"Oh-ho! A threat, it is?"

"A promise," Jalinda said, nibbling on Thulka's ear seductively. The ogress pushed her away.

"None of that now, barmaid, or we'll waste the afternoon as well and never get anywhere."

"I don't think it's such a waste..."

"Insatiable little thing, aren't you?"

"Well, that little ritual of yours burned up all the food in my stomach, and there was barely enough left for a snack. I need more!"

"Armor first. You're just about bursting out of those cheap tavern rags."

"Fine. Armor first, my love, then satisfaction!"

As the day wore on, and the sun sank low in the sky, they found no sign of an armor shop nor a food store, however. Indeed, even a simple roadside inn failed to make an appearance. Just when they were ready to give up and camp by the side of the road, Thulka and Jalinda discovered...
1111221221.title: The Bond of Kings

choices: Thulka and Jalinda eat and ask about the state of affairs.
Thulka finds herself worrying about Jalinda's appetite more than her own.
11112212212.content:
Weary yet alert sentries gazed down at the traveling pair, entry secured into the fortress after a thorough questioning by the head watchman of the walls. Once inside, they found alert citizens as well, all of them staring intently at the two.

"Why are all these humans so gaze-happy?" Thulka grunted out.

"I'm not sure. I did hear some mumblings about border attacks by the wights. We must be closer than we thought to one of the outposts."

Thulka grunted again as she pondered what her mate had said, looking over and noticing a slight shiver in Jalinda's shoulders. Sure she had recently gained a fair amount of padding and that should have shielded her enough from the biting wind but it obviously wasn't enough. Removing a cloak from the pony trailing behind them, Thulka slipped the piece of clothing over Jalinda's shoulders.

"You shouldn't be cold," Thulka said to Jalinda's questioning eyes.

"Thank you."

For some reason, the ogress felt a rush of gratitude and contentment at the look and sound of thanks from her mate, swiftly shaking her head. No, she can't be developing simpering sentimentality now! That was for humans not for an ogre like her. But maybe, maybe there was more to the Bond of Kings than just binding Jalinda to her and changing her mate's figure and partly her species. Jalinda's stomach rumbled then and she let out an ogreish grunt.

"Hungry."

Jalinda smirked. Now there was a feeling she could relate to, steering their mount and pony towards the closest tavern, offering a hand to help Jalinda down.

Her mate shouldn't hurt herself due to such a petty act as falling off a horse.

At least, that's how Thulka rationalized her act of chivalry and kindness.
11112212212.title: A heavily-guarded fortress.

choices: "Negotiators Wanted to Retrieve Prisoners from the Ice Dragon."
"Looking For Volunteers For Wight-Slaying Squad."
111122122121.content:
"Oof." Thulka leaned back in the commissary booth, unbuckling her studded leather belt. "I'm done."

"Oh, now don't say that," Jalinda said. "Provisioner! My friend here would like another platter of food."

"Your friend said she's done," Thulka growled. "Anything else you get, you're eating." Already, they were getting even more stares from the soldiers and assembled civilian workers than before; she dreaded standing up.

"Oh, you're no fun," Jalinda pouted. "I thought you ogres -- we ogres -- were always up to a challenge."

Thulka grinned, displaying her massive canines. "As a matter of fact, I do have a challenge in mind. A damn near impossible one."

"Ooh, really?" Jalinda perked up. "What is it? A dozen suckling pigs in one sitting? An entire bathtub full of beer?"

"Even harder," Thulka said with a wide. "Finding a suit of armor that will fit those fat hams of yours."

------

Fortunately, the fort occasionally hired mercenaries for extra muscle, and the armorer had previously done some work for ogres, trolls, and the odd minotaur or two. He had several breastplates suitable for an extra-large wearer stored in the back of the shop, and after a bit of a struggle with the straps (Jalinda had obviously never worn armor in her life) the two of them managed to get her in it.

Jalinda looked herself over in the mirror, a look of dismay on her face. "Oh, not this!"

"What's wrong with it?"

"I look like I'm wearing a tin can!"

Thulka raised an eyebrow. "Do you know what 'armor' is, honey?"

"But-- but it's not sexy at all! I thought, you know, something that -- you know -- hugged me a little more, to show off my curves."

Thulka burst out in a loud bark of laughter.

"Oh, shut it!" Jalinda said, blushing furiously. "You liked them well enough before!"

"That's not why I'm laughing," Thulka explained. "I forgot what a novice you were. Fitted armor! You want fitted armor, with the amount you eat? We'd have to buy a new set every week! Don't you know how expensive armor is?"

"N-no... is it a lot?"

"It's plenty, trust me." Thulka sighed, seeing how disappointed Jalinda looked. "FINE. I guess you'll probably burn a little of that off adventuring anyway. Speaking of which, after this armor and our recent food bills, we're going to need to find something pretty quick..."

----

Thulka read over the jobs boards in front of the commissary, looking for the telltale black skull mark that indicated risk to life and limb (and better pay). The pickings were slim; a fort filled with soldiers was more in need of maids and horse-brushers than monster slayers. Still, she found a couple of prospects.

"I just love my new armor," Jalinda said, admiring herself. "Thank you again, honey!" She gave Thulka a peck on the cheek.

"Don't see how you're comfortable in something that's basically a stainless steel corset," Thulka grumbled, embarrassed. "And what if someone shoots an arrow at your chest? Your tits are plumped out there like two turkeys in a serving tureen."

"Admit it, you like it."

"You'd just better not fatten out of it too quickly. We haven't got enough money left over to buy you a potato sack."

Jalinda placed a hand on Thulka's stomach, which still bulged slightly from her commissary feast. "You're the one I want to fatten up, remember?"

"Did you forget the part where I said my purse was empty? If we want to eat, we'll have to do a job first. Look, here's a couple of prospects--"

The next day, the elven mage wishes to speak with them.

Thulka snorted at the first option. "Definitely not. Wights it is then."

"But can we really kill wights? Aren't they undead bones reanimated by dark magic?"

"Aye, but a stout blow will undo the bond that knits their moldy bones together. Though in your case I suppose your arse would crush them easier than a blow from my axe."

Jalinda whacked Thulka on the head and that and Thulka grinned. She had definitely chosen well for a mate, Jalinda not afraid at all of striking back when teased. "Well with how big you're going to get off of our pay for this mission, you'll be squashing them with a big arse of your own, dear."

"Enough banter, let's find the captain of this squad and go about our business."

Jalinda nodded and followed after her mate, sticking a little closer than usual after noticing the glares and stares heading her way, Thulka's arm wrapping around her side and keeping her there as they wandered towards the directions indicated on the poster.

///

"You I'll take, but the fat one will have to stay."

Thulka shook her head. "We are bonded. Where I go, she goes."

The captain sighed at that, knowing he didn't have any other option. He needed all the aid he could get and an ogress warrior would be quite the aid indeed.

So, Thulka, Jalinda, and a party of twelve other volunteers made their way from the garrison to a cave infested with wights. It was the closest staging ground for attacks on the hold. Jalinda held her broadsword as Thulka had taught her, a part of her more than a little frightened of the darkness all around but another, wilder part of her was looking forward to the coming combat.

Must be the ogre in me, Jalinda thought.

But just after she thought this, the wights pounced. Wailing, lip-less maws opening wide, they screamed and struck with inhuman strength. Already one of the volunteers had fallen but another, an elven mage, soon cast a fire spell, enchanting the weapons of the surviving members with flame. Striking as hard as she could, Jalinda felt the strength of the blow as it caved in a wight's chest. She was so ecstatic that she didn't see a bony hand rushing towards her exposed side.

Luckily, Thulka's weapon blocked the fatal blow and a riposte ended the foe. More wights came but by this time the momentum had shifted and the party ventured further until, less than an hour later, the entirety of the cave had been explored. The last of the wights lay at the captain's feet and the group cheered.

Taking her share, she looked at Thulka.

Opening the bag and handing her mate half, she winked at her.

Thulka nodded at that, following after her mate and enjoying the sight of Jalinda's quivering rear as it jiggled to and fro.

The sun was already sinking in the sky as Thulka tightened the straps on Enormerous' studded leather saddle. A late start, she clucked to herself. Sloppy.

"It'll be dark in an hour," Jalinda said. "Why don't we stay here for another night?"

Thulka threw one muscular leg over her mount's back, grunting as her overfull stomach shifted. Jalinda had, of course, insisted on a large lunch before they set out, one that had stretched long into the afternoon, and even another bout of lovemaking hadn't sufficed to burn it off.

"Because," Thulka teased, "if all we do is stay here and eat, we'll soon be too fat to fight. And then where will we get money?"

"Who needs money when you have your very own food-conjuring mage?" Jalinda replied.

"We do, unless you want to live in a giant hollowed-out suckling pig!"

Jalinda grinned. "Could have its advantages."

Glinda stepped into the room, adjusting the clasp of a crimson riding cloak around. Spindly runes had been applied in white-gold leaf, making the entire garment catch the setting sun in a show of reflected gold and orange.

"Finally ready? I thought you two would never get out of bed."

"Ready, indeed. We'll need to make good time to reach Sorrowtop Hill by nightfall. Mind you don't fall behind, elf."

"Oh, don't worry about me. Just pretend I'm not here."

"That," Thulka said with a smile, "I can do."

"Mind telling me why we're heading towards the northern wastes?" the elf ventured. "I've always here there was little in the way of either civilization or natural resources there."

"Natural, no," Thulka snorted. "But unnatural resources it has in spades. A good thick wendigo hide removed in one piece can fetch up to a thousand on today's market, and the demand for sin crystals keeps rising every year. I suppose you'd know little of the North, though -- where are you from? The Solar Coast, I'll bet. Somewhere soft and comfortable."

The mage fixed her with a look. "Bluespring, actually. I learned my conjuration magic at the Scientific Academy, with a speciliazation focus on cookery. I trust it will meet with your satisfaction?"

"Let's hope so," Thulka shrugged. Her stomach emitted a pained warning gurgle. Just -- not just at this second!

11112212212122112.content:
Luckily for Thulka, her stomach digested the massive meal she had been cajoled into eating by her mate, the ogress feeling comfortable by the time night had fallen though they were still in the foothills.

The kindling she had gathered was proving ineffective and Thulka swore at the pieces of wood before Glinda strode forward and soon enough a bright blaze was cutting through the darkness, giving Thulka enough light to see. Moving towards Jalinda, who was struggling to set up her side of the single tent they had brought, Thulka took the burden she was wrestling with.

"Don't overdo things, I don't want to see you hurt."

Jalinda smiled widely at that and turned such a loving gaze to Thulka that it made the ogress sick. "I only mean that it would be unseemly of an ogress to have her mate be injured. It makes me look weak!"

Jalinda just smirked and patted Thulka on her stomach, a stomach that was a tad softer than usual owing to the feeding sessions the pair had been through. "Whatever you say, Thulka dearest."

Blushing as an ogre was wont to do, which meant her cheeks were now darker than before, Thulka spied Glinda watching the pair and scribbling something down in a large scroll.

"I don't see how that exchange could possibly be of any value to you!"

"Well it's not everyday that one finds an ogress willingly admitting to not liking the sight of someone hurt."

As the couple entered the tower, they heard a squawk. Thulka looked up and saw a blue parrot roosting in a nook on the wall. "I was wondering when you'd get here," the parrot said in a high-pitched voice.

"Still need to work on your greetings, Ruffles," Thulka replied. "Could you let Gringen know we're here?"

His head was bald, but his white beard and mustache were very impressive. He wore a simple robe of green, which matched the color of his eyes. Moving surprisingly fast for one so old, he crossed from the stairs and got close enough to where Thulka could pick him up and hug him.

"Ah! Not so rough! You'll crush this old gnome to a pulp!" he said.

Thulka said him down. "It's been too long, Gringen," she said with a smile.

"It has indeed, Thulka. And who is this you've brought with you?" Gringen asked.

"Please... We would be grateful if you could help us," Jalinda said.

Another hour of riding and a great goblin warren stood before her, the earthen mound pockmarked with holes to clamber into and out of, and a set of gates made of pig bones tied with twine barred the largest opening. All grew quiet. The goblin guardsmen steeled themselves. Thulka smirked. A hundred of them couldn't have stopped her, clobbering this handful wouldn't even be good exercise. She tensed her muscles, and then...

A loud, obnoxious sound pierced the silence, like a bone-saw through a roasted fellswine haunch. It had come from inside the goblin hold. A call to arms?
"All hail Chief Fuzgriggle!" shrieked a reedy, nasally voice from behind the bone gates, which shortly swung open after another noisome blast from the goblin horn.

The carved stump on his head and worg-pelt cape wrapped round his bony shoulders marked him as a chieftain, and only he seemed unafraid of the interloper that stood before them.

"Straight to the point, eh? Admirable." The chief goblin let out a little chuckle, like swamp water gurgling down a rusty drain. "You're quite right, of course. I've not come forth from the safety of my throne-pit to shower an invader with blandishments. I've a proposition for you, Lady Thudcrush..."

The goblins, on the other hand, would have offered nothing: neither resistance to her intrusion or a filling meal. Colossal muscles clung to his legs, allowing him to carry all of the loot Thulka had acquired thus far. And finally, like most oxen, he also sported a thick layer of fat, hence his name. Thulka knelt down, reaching for the saddle bag. It had nearly been crushed during the commotion but thankfully escaped harm. Reaching inside, she pulled out the necessary tools: a carving machete, flint and tinder, and a load of spices. She had looted them from a noble's house the last town over and was eager to give them a taste. Blade in hand, she set the blade against Enormous's neck and dug in.

---

Two hours later, and the deed was done. Enormous has been thoroughly cleaned of his edible parts, leaving behind little more than bones and organs. A raging fire had been started as well. It burned brightly against the setting sun, fighting against it with it's rapidly growing brilliance. Besides it sat Thulka, armed with a piercing rod, and the spoils of the oxen's demise. She was all set to begin roasting when she realized something awful.

Enormous had been carrying the bulk of her things. Without him, she could probably manage to drag her new loot until a new mount was procured. However, she hadn't been taking into account all the meat. As gluttonous as she was feeling, she couldn't imagine eating it all in one night. Nor could she stomach leaving such delicious food behind. What was a poor ogress to do?
113.title: An Enormous Meal

choices: Pillaging it
Selling her loot.
Finding more food.
1131.content:
Delaying her warpath was out of the question, as was simply abandoning the meat. As painful as it was surely going to be, Thulka was going to have to stuff herself to oblivion.

Eagerly, the yellow giant groped into the pile beside her, pulling out a five pound chunk of oxen meat. Without delay she shoved her piercing rod into the moist flesh. She pressed down hard, letting it slide to around the halfway point. It stuck fast to the metal stick, holding firm even when she gave it a inquisitive shake. Confident with its stability, she at last shoved the meat into the wild blaze, engulfing it in flames. It crackled as the moisture within started to boil.

Five minutes later, Thulka pulled the meat out. She had timed it well; the meat had been charred to absolute perfection. It gave off a pleasant, savory smell. Her mouth salivated in anticipation as the starved barbarian brought it up to her thick lips. Like a snapping turtle she shot forward, her strong jaw easily severing half of the meat off the rod. It was sent to the back of her wet mouth, sliding down her throat without a single chew. Thulka rubbed her exposed, flat abs in relief. It felt good to have some REAL food in her stomach for a change. Smiling ear to ear, she followed up and bit off the last half as easily as the first. It joined its other half in her grumbling, near empty stomach.

---

Two hours later and Thulka sat half awake against the slowly dying fire. The pile of meat was noticeably smaller; a rather large chunk of it sat in her filled pained stomach. It strained outwards, bulging out in a spherical shape. The pounds of meat gave her midsection an almost pregnant look. Thulka, her mind thoroughly weakened by the stuffing, collapsed to the side, exhausted. She drifted off to sleep, her stomach churning madly.

---

Thulka awoke with a pleasant yawn, the sun shining warmly on her face. The fire had died naturally and the meat pile seemed undisturbed. To her side lay the piercing rod, still holding a piece she had neglected to eat. Most importantly, though, was her stomach. While not nearly as bulbous as it had been, it pushed outward slightly. Not putting much thought into it, she assumed that she had not fully digested her meal. Little did she know, she had in fact gained a few pounds of fat, manifesting on her in the form of a small potbelly.

Standing up, Thulka began to pack her things to leave. She had places to go and people to pillage, after all. It didn't take long and before long she set off, her new potbelly jiggling with each step. The ogress had decided to march in the direction of the human village, intent on...
1131.title: Stuffing her Face

choices: "are free to walk around the village, though we'll be watching you."
"are coming with us, you must meet our elder."
11312.content:
Thulka marched down the rolling hill, intent on selling her looted goods to the humans. There was absolutely no reason for her not to; the weight of her magnificent plunder would be unbearable for an extended journey. Worst of all, a full load meant that she all new plunder would go to waste!

A good half an hour passed before the ogress found herself at the edge of the humble human hamlet. A few dozen tiny thatched roof cottages speckled the forest clearing in which the town laid, their monotony broken every so often by shops or merchant stalls. Judging by their size and sparsity, Thulka estimated that their had to be around a hundred inhabitants of this place. Most surprising of all was the village's defenselessness; from her position, she saw no semblance of the law. A perfect target for a pillage, if only she had the will to do so.

Intrigued by this undefended village, Thulka made her way into the village with booming stomps. There was no real gate for her to pass through; only a larger opening between two houses with a sign that said "Welcome!" clued her in. Dust flew into the air with each aggravated stomp, leaving a thick brown cloud behind her. It was not a subtle entrance, nor a particularly friendly one, but she knew it was for the best. If they were to be hostile, at least she would know before she wound up trapped in the village center.

That was the plan, at least. A finely sharpened spear found its way to her midsection as her foot passed the first building, stopping just before it finished its deadly thrust. Two more appeared in an instant, holding fast at her neck and chest before the stunned woman could reach for ol' Head-Smasherizer. Standing beside her were three men, decked out in leather armor and wielding the spears the held her in place. From their posture, it was clear they weren't out for her blood, but they were by no means friendly.

"Raaaaaaaaaaaawr!" she roared in defiance. "Let me free, you stinking humans!"

In most cases, her ear-splitting roar was enough to send people running, but these men did not move an inch.

"Hold still, you bloody ogress, our mage will be here shortly to verify you," the man jutting her stomach said.

Her anger unabated, she bellowed out another roar, once again to no affect. A tense minute passed as Thulka and her captors stared each other down, both hoping the other would grant them a chance to strike out. Alas, the moment never came.

"Alright, alright, I'm here," said an aged voice from behind the ogress. "Oh my, she's quiet a big one, isn't she?"

Craning her head around, Thulka's eyes met with the source. It was an older looking gentleman, face wrinkled like an old raisin and balder than a newborn. His brown robes were etched with countless arcane symbols, the most prominent of which was a symbol of a glowing hog. Without warning, the man raised his left hand and shoved it into Thulka's pudgy gut. An unintelligible whisper of magical escaped from his withered lips. A pulsing warmth radiated from his palm, tickling her stomach. She would have laughed, if not for being so furious.

"Let's see," the wizard began, "From what my 'Composition' spell can tell, she's not eaten humans. All this fat's from a mule."

"I-it's not fat! I'm just digesting a meal from earlier..." she said, embarrassed. Ogres were renowned for their great strength, not their great girth.

"Bull!" the wizard shouted as he slapped the flesh, causing her pudgy fat to jiggle. "A stuffed stomach wouldn't jiggle like that."

"Why, I aughta k-"

"Quiet, both of you!" the man poking her stomach shouted. "Now then, Ogress, since you haven't eaten any humans, you..."
11312.title: Caught Unaware

choices: Getting revenge on that wizard.
Finding an inn to stay at.
113121.content:
"Now then, Ogress, since you haven't eaten any humans, you are free to walk around the village, though we'll be watching you."

The three men lowered their weapons in perfect sync, freeing Thulka from their grip. With her anger still blazing like a oil fire, she was tempted to strike the fools down now, but held back. There would be absolutely nothing to gain from such wanton violence. Still, the wizard's comments on her fat had bruised her titanic pride. Plans for revenge against the old geezer began to take form in her mind as she left the four behind, ducking into the safety of the nearby general store.

It was an unimposing little shop, its worn counters and shelves littered with ragged and damaged wares. Nothing of particular value seemed to reside within its walls, dampening her hopes for a big pay off.

"Anyone here?" she asked to the empty shop.

"Sorry about that, miss," a woman replied, popping up from behind a counter. She was a chubby girl, blessed with curly blonde locks.

"Ah," the shop-keep continued, "You must have been the one stomping around out there."

"Indeed, I like to make my presence known. Now then, are you interested in purchasing some of my loot?"

Thulka reached back into her satchel and tossed it onto the nearby counter, letting its glittering contents tumble into the open. It was a beautiful assortment of jewels and jewelry, worth hundreds of gold. An impressive sight; one that made the shopkeepers eyes go wide in pure awe.

"Woah, where did you get all this?"

"Not important. What matters is the price, woman."

"Straight to the point, eh?" she said as she examined the bounty laid before her. "Well, with all of this here, I could offer you... 800 gold?"

"Ha! Try 1500, at the very least."

"Sorry, ogress, but have you seen our village? You think I have enough on me for that? 1000 at the most."

Thulka turned to the nearby window, uttering an annoyed grunt. First she had been hassled and now she wasn't even going to get the full price for her items. Looking through the glass pane, Thulka noticed something she had missed on the way in. Chained to a post beside the shop was a great oxen, not unlike Enormous. Like most of the village, it was an old thing, more fat than muscle. Not the best pack animal around, but she couldn't deny that the thought of digging into him was making her mouth water.

"Say, is that your oxen?"

"Why yes it is. His name's Dusty; been mine since childhood."

"How about you give me a thousand and the oxen for the whole bag?"

The woman didn't even hesitate before shouting out her agreement.

---

Merely twenty minutes later and Thulka was standing outside the shop, once again astride her great ox companion. The poor thing nearly buckled under the weight, unfamiliar with the stress of being a pack animal.

"Easy there, Enormous the sixth. I just got you!" she said playfully to the animal. Tugging on his lead rope, the left the shop behind, intent on...
113121.title: Shopping

12.content:
Applying another glob of polish to her cloth, Eilowyn scrubbed and wiped until every last bit of undead flesh had been removed from her breastplate. It had been a big job -- partly because she was so conscientious, and partly because she was so busty. Of course, this wasn't a regular breastplate -- it was one of those form-fitting fantasy breastplates with individual cups. Nevertheless, it was now spic and span and shiny enough to see her rosy-cheeked face in.

She hung it back on the rack and, after admiring it for a moment, started in on her greaves, which were a rather big job on their own. She'd been waist-deep in ghouls for a good part of that last crypt, and her hips weren't anything to sneeze at size-wise either. Fortunately, if there was one thing the barracks of the Holy Order of Eola had plenty of, it was polish.

Suddenly, she heard something.
12.title: Eilowyn Honeyridge

choices: Eola kisses Eilowyn and she becomes a bit chubby, staring her on her new purpose
Eola rubs Eilowyn's stomach, imparting her love of food and caring to the dwarf.
Eola merely winks and tells Eilowyn to head towards the nearest poor farmer.
122.content:
The very air seemed to cheer and cry out as Eilowyn's goddess appeared before her.

Resplendent in her ethereal armor, Eilowyn bowed deeply, removing her helmet as she did so.

"Great Eola, how may I serve you?"

The goddess smiled warmly at her champion and lightly tugged on Eilowyn's pig-tails, making the dwarf look up.

"Oh Eilly! Your hair is so beautiful! Why do you have to always cover it up so?"

Eilowyn blushed at her deity's behavior. "I...It is unseemly of a member of your Holy Order to be so vain about their appearance. We live to protect people and slay evil, not strive for vain and fleeting beauty."

Her goddess pouted then but soon sighed. "You're right Eilly. You're just the cutest of my followers! Anyway, I have a mission for you."

"Anything, great Eola, just name it."

"Well...it involves a wee bit of sacrifice."

"What kind of sacrifice?"

Eola's form changed then, her armor dissolving and her toned body expanding, growing larger than the fattest creature Eilowyn had ever seen.

"You...you wish me to give up my figure?"

"Not if you don't want to. I want you to become my representative in the mortal realm and you do know I am also the Goddess of Plenty, correct?"

"Of course."

"Well then, as my avatar, I want you to travel from town to town, partaking in the plenty of the land. As you grow, so too does my influence. Your paladin spells will also increase and your presence will drive away the spirits of famine and poverty that lie in wait for mortal failings. You shall be a symbol of hope for the downtrodden, a beacon of beautiful bounty. No more covering up those cute pig-tails of yours. Are you still willing to undertake this mission, even though it will mean the end of your armor-wearing days and your fit form?"

Eola had slimmed back down by this point, her armor reappearing as well.

Eilowyn gulped but nodded.

"Of course Eola, as you will it!"

Eola beamed and pressed her favorite paladin's face to her bosom.

"Oh Eilly, thank you so much!"
122.title: The Will of Eola

choices: The Duke's castle
The kitchen of the barracks
A nearby farming village, devastated by famine
1221.content:
The goddess pulled the her faithful paladin from her breast, allowing the girl a much needed breath. Her face now upturned, their gazes met once more. A divine sense of belonging radiated from her lord's perfect face. It filled Eilowyn with an overwhelming feeling. One that she hadn't felt in all her time serving Eola on the front lines. Cutting down undead had never felt this good.

"Okay, next up is your blessing then! I hope you enjoy it, Eilly."

A playful smile crossed Eola's face as she snapped her glowing fingers. In an instant, Eilowyn's robust suit of plate vanished in a puff of smoke, leaving her hefty bosom hanging plainly in the air. Twinges of regret shot through the young servant. She was well aware that the armor would serve her no longer but something inside couldn't let go of it so easily. Sensing her servant's growing regret, Eola bent forward and met her lips with Eilowyn's. Eilly's eyes grew wide. She had been caught off guard, but after a moment, closed her eyes.

A strange, almost magical, wave of energy began to leave the goddess's body. Like a snake is traveled through her puckered lips and forced its way into the dwarf's. From there it continued on, crawling down her throat. Surprisingly, Eilly didn't seem to mind the feeling. Like the gaze, it was comforting in a way.

After a moment, Eola pulled away, a thin string of spit still connecting the two. She gazed downwards past Eilly's breasts and began to giggle.

"What's so funny, milord?" Eilly asked.

The laughing woman reached forward and squeezed a part of her body that Eilly didn't know existed. She knew that there should have been nothing to grab yet the playful pinching sensation continued. Parting her breasts, she at last got a clear view of her body. Her stomach, once flat from her order's exercise routine, had been blessed with a small pocket of fat. The soft excess flesh hung off hung from her abdomen as Eola continued to fondle it.

"How do ya like it, Eilly? You look soooo cute with this belly!"

"So this is what is feels like to have fat? I must say, I can't exactly complain." she admitted.

"Yay! I knew you'd love it! Now, you'll find more elastic clothing in that box over there, alright?" Eola said, motioning to a small box to Eilly's right. "Now go and become my blubbery avatar!"

Her work done, the goddess disappeared as quickly as she had come, taking the ethereal warmth with her. Left alone, Eilly rifled through the box and pulled out her new uniform. It was a form fitting thing, low cut to show off her deep cleavage and containing a gap at her midsection to show off her growing belly. The symbol of her goddess was embroidered neatly in the space between the openings.

Gathering her supplies, Eilly decided to go to...
1221.title: A Growing Blessing

choices: -- the leader of her order, who believes her vision was false.
-- agents of Eola's rival gods, seeking to disrupt her mission.
1223.content:
Old Herbert eyed the alabaster steed thundering down the back country road. It was certainly rare to see such a fine horse in such a backwater farming town as this -- and he was even more surprised when the horse slowed to a canter, then a trot, and finally stopped in front of his simple sod hut.

"Mistress paladin," he said, attempting to bow but not quite remembering how you bowed to a paladin, "to what do I owe the pleasure? There are no ghouls around here, nor ghasts, no, nary a one."

The gleaming rider dismounted, removing her helmet and shaking out her hair. "I come not to hunt, good farmer, but on fairer business. I seek a meal prepared from the finest bounty of your farm."

"Of -- of course. At once!" Old Herbert said, attempting to sound thrilled. You were supposed to give a paladin on business anything she asked for, of course, but he didn't know how they were going to spare the expense -- they needed the money those crops would bring in just to pay the landlord and mend the plow before next season. Perhaps the gods were punishing him. What was he going to tell his wife, Old Herbetta, and his son, Old Herbert the Younger?

"Now, I wouldn't expect you to do it for free," the paladin said, tossing the farmer a few gold coins. "Here. Take this -- and prepare no more than it's worth!"

Eilowyn watched his eyes light up as he scurried away. Perhaps if I pace myself, she thought, I will be able to spread the word of Eola without growing fat too rapidly. It shamed her to go against the word of the goddess, even in her heart -- but she at least wanted to have a little time with her armor before she had to stay goodbye. A few gold pieces worth of vegetables at a time should keep the weight from really hitting her for a while.

----

It was sometime around her second roast chicken that it really started to hit home to Eilowyn exactly how out of touch she was with just how much three gold pieces was worth to a poor farmer.

"Is there a single stalk left in your fields?" she groaned miserably. "Or have I eaten it all?"

"I'm afraid you've eaten us bare," Old Herbert said, staring at the mountain of clean dishes in awe. "Will -- will you be wanting two of the coins back, then? Or shall I send the boy over to the Rustfield place, to buy a little extra--"

"No!" Eilowyn moaned. "No more food! I'll burst!"

"Will you be needing a bed for the evening?"

Eilowyn nodded. "I'm afraid I'll need to impose. I cannot ride in this condition. But please -- do send the boy to get something for your own breakfast, and some oats for Blizzard."

She waddled off to the bedroom, collapsing onto the spare cot and falling into a deep food coma within seconds.

"Such a hungry lass," Old Herbetta said, tapping her chin with her finger. "I didn't know as dwarves et so much."

"We ought to get something for her breakfast as well. Surely she'll be wantin' it," Old Herbert said, "and it'll be a nice surprise."

Little did Eilowyn know that her quest was about to be further complicated by --
1223.title: Three Gold Pieces' Worth

It's a traveling food merchant.
12231.content:
Robin Starwind shielded her eyes from the sun's bright glare. Behind her rode a squad of calvary.

"As you are aware, Eilowyn, our sister, has gone mad. She has claimed that Eola has visited her and asked to be made her avatar on the planet. Clearly she has been possessed by an evil spirit to sow confusion within our ranks. We are going to hunt her down and purge this spirit from her body!"

///

Eilowyn woke up with a grunt, sitting up in bed. She heard a familiar giggle and gasped as she saw her goddess at her bedside.

"My dear Eilly, you're already getting pretty chubby!"

"I haven't eaten that much, my goddess, I-" but then Eola interrupted her by poking her in her stomach. The dwarf blushed when she felt a jiggle. Looking down, she saw that she now had a pot-belly. Along with this, she felt a bit of thickness around her rear, thighs, and face.

"You look even more adorable now! Unfortunately, you have a squad of your fellow paladins riding to find you. They're convinced you are possessed."

"Can't you appear in front of them and tell them the truth?"

Eola shook her head. "I can't solve all your problems for you Eilly, but don't worry, I am with you."

Kissing the dwarf's pot belly, Eola vanished.

Getting to her feet, Eiowynn prepared her things when she heard something...
12231.title: False visions?

choices: "... submit to trial by single combat.  We'll see who the goddess favors."
"... return with me and let the exorcists examine you."
122311.content:
"Eilowyn Honeyridge! Come out at once!"

Eilowyn recognized the voice as that of Robin Starwind. She groaned. Sister Starwind was a hardass in every sense of the term. She couldn't imagine her being very happy about Eilowyn shirking her usual duties in favor of riding around the countryside feeding her face.

"We have evacuated the farmers. Come out or we'll put this place to the torch!"

Gah! "I'm coming, I'm coming!" she shouted out the window. "Give me one second, would you?"

That was Robin Starwind. She would hang a dog to get rid of a flea. Eilowyn stuffed herself into her armor as quickly as she could, which was no easy task. Getting the breastplate to meet with the backplate was like trying to close an overfilled suitcase.

Hup, hup, hyyyuhh! She gave it one more shove, sucking in her stomach as she did so, and managed to get the plates closed and buckled. Dusting herself off and making sure everything was straight and neat, she stepped outside to face the music.

Her belly squashed uncomfortably against the form-fitting armor as she walked; its tapered waist refused to acknowledge the extra padding beneath. If I put on any more weight, she thought morosely, I'm going to have to have it hammered out...

"Eilowyn Honeyridge," Sister Starwind said again, fixing her with her steel-grey eyes. "You are not well. You must return with us for cleansing."

"This is a mission from the goddess," Eilowyn explained. "I don't really expect you to believe me, but as it isn't hurting the order as a whole..."

"Not hurting the order?" Starwind said incredulously. "To have one of our fighters neglecting her work, riding around the countryside, and gorging herself into a little butterball?"

"I'm not--"

"Don't lie to me, Sister. I can hear the buckles straining from here." Starwind tried to sound concilatory, not something she was especially good at. "Please. You're not well, Eilowyn. You must be cleansed."

Eilowyn shook her head. "It is Eola's will."

"Prove it...."
122311.title: Confrontation

choices: Eilowyn's next stop is a cozy village with a famous buffet.
Follow Robin and see how she tries to relax.
1223111.content:
Eilowyn gulped. Sure, she was a capable warrior in her own right, having fought her fair share of battles, but Robin Starwind was a legend among the order, slaying a clan of dragons all by herself. Still, she couldn't fail, not when her goddess had need of her. So, grabbing her saber, she went to the center of the ring composed of her fellow paladins, Robin waiting with her own weapon drawn.

"May Eola bless this battle," Robin stated, her eyes never leaving Eilowyn.

The dwarf nodded at her human sister and before she could blink Robin was on her, slashing and thrusting. Blocking the initial slash, she dodged the thrust by a hair, a wheeze escaping her lips as she did so. Robin smirked and pressed on, but the dwarf managed to either counter or dodge.

"Quit dancing and fight me!"

Eilowyn did so, launching her own mighty thrust, Robin managing to block and return with a slash of her own. Blocking it, Eilowyn pushed then and Robin landed on her rear. Face red, Robin aimed for the dwarf's legs, scoring a minor hit.

Ignoring the slight flare of pain, Eilowyn used Robin's confidence to her advantage, using the hilt of her sword to strike a strong blow against Robin's head, dazing the famed warrior.

Silence reigned all around and Robin's standard bearer declared Eilowyn the winner.

Robin got to her feet, a bit shaky and bowed to her dwarf sister. "I...I have lost..."

As she said this, the golden glow of Eola gathered around Robin and the gathered paladins, save Eilowyn, gaped as Robin's body changed. Her toned middle expanded, becoming a hefty belly, her thighs and rear growing to a heavy size as well. Lastly, her breasts and face puffed outwards, a few chins dangling beneath her original one, Robin's armor now at her feet.

Eola herself soon appeared after that, the goddess appearing quite tubby as well, though not as much as Robin herself was. "Let this weight be a reminder of the dangers of assumptions, Robin Starwind. You are still a beloved servant of mine and I wish you lay down your arms for a season or two and reconnect with your appetite and the bounty of the lands you have protected with your might these past sixteen years. Do you understand?"

Robin bowed low. "My apologies, goddess. I will accept this weight and obey your wish."

Eola's stern demeanor dropped in an instant and she easily picked up Robin and hugged her now fat servant tightly. "Oh Robin! You're almost as cute as Eilly with your serious ways!"

Robin blushed heavily but accepted the outburst as well as the big kiss Eola placed on her stomach and fat cheeks.

"Well, I've appeared before you mortals enough for one day. Eilly, you know what you must do. Robin, you have your own assignment. As for the rest of you noble warriors, go out and continue protecting the land and people but don't forget to have some fun and pig out once in awhile!"

All the assembled paladins bowed, Eola blushing. "Oh please stop, you're embarrassing me!"

With another flash of golden light, the goddess was gone.

Eilowyn blinked a bit but soon turned around, her gaze towards the road that would take her to her next meal but was stopped by a fat hand on her shoulder. Looking behind her, she saw Robin's gleaming grey eyes.

"Safe journey, dear sister Eilowyn and if you need any aid, all of us are here for you."

Eilowyn nodded, eyes going a bit watery as she shared a flabby hug with the leader of her order. "Thank you, sister Robin. I wish you a nice, relaxing, season."

Robin nodded at that and turned around, ordering the rest of the paladins to take their leave at once.

Once the group was nothing but a speck on the horizon and Eilowyn had said goodbye to the farmer and his family, the dwarf started on her quest anew, a smile on her face and her armor groaning with every step.
