Snip wakes up the next morning a bit chubby.
13.content:
Snip Windfingers was currently at her favorite bar in all of Squallhirst, one frequented by rogues of all sorts.

It felt like home to the halfling thief. Pockets were freely picked, fights broke out, and both the men and women were pleasing to the eye.

But, as Snip observed the controlled chaos all around, sipping her ale, she noticed a human woman and a pixie female approaching, gulping her drink down fast and making for the exit.

Unfortunately she wasn't fast enough, as the human woman soon had her by the ear.

"Snip Windfingers, where are you off to in such a hurry? The last time you shared my bed you said you would stay with me forever."

"Snip here has a tendency to gild her tongue with lies, my dear Theodora. Why a month ago she promised me the greatest jewel of the old Orc King's fabled treasure trove," the pixie commented, slapping Snip as hard as she could with her tiny palm.

"Ladies, I understand that I've broken my fair share of promises but let us let bygones be bygones. You won't see me again if you let me go now."

"No, Snip, you shall not slink away to break another person's heart," Theodora murmured, her voice deepening as Snip felt the familiar tingle of magic in the air, gulping in a bit of fear now. Theodora was quite the mage after all. A burst of energy engulfed Snip then and the halfling was ready for the end of her thieving days.

But once the energy had subsided, Snip was still alive.

GURGLE...

Snip's eyes widened as her toned middle roared in hunger.

Seeing a serving wench carrying a greasy meat pie, Snip snapped it up and shoved it into her mouth, moving on to a flagon of ale and devouring that as well.

"What did...MMMFFFF...you...MMMM...do to me?" Snip managed to say as she stuffed her face.

The pixie giggled as she landed on Snip's rounding stomach as she stuffed her face more. "Theodora's placed a great hunger in your stomach Snip. You might keep the pangs at bay through stuffing yourself, but eventually, in a few fortnights, you will be hopelessly lost to your own appetite. That is...unless you appease us."

"What-BURAAAPPP-what do I have to do?" Snip asked, blushing after her belch but grabbing up even more food.

"That's simple Snip. You merely have to get past the many traps and monsters surrounding the Orc King's fabled tomb and steal the greatest jewel of the lot as you promised poor Alys here," Theodora answered, motioning towards her pixie companion.

By this point, Snip was well and truly stuffed, her halfling stomach bulging and taut.

"Very well, I shall do this and you shall release the spell, agreed?"

Theodora smirked as she shook her former lover's hand, poking Snip's stomach afterwards, Snip belching again and groaning. "Of course, my bloated halfling. But you need your rest, do you not? Such a large amount of food in that trim stomach of yours. I wonder where it will end up after it has digested?"

Alys giggled at that and darted in front of Snip's face.

"The Tubby Thief is a title I feel you should get used to before too long, my dear Snip."

Alys placed a kiss on Snip's middle then and darted away to Theodora's shoulder, Snip sighing and making her way up to her rented room.
13.title: Snip Windfingers

choices: Several days later, while staying in an unfamiliar inn...
Over a week later, as they approached the tomb...
131.content:
Snip grumbled to herself as she put one boot in front of another on the dew-moistened road. That stupid spell! It hadn't even let her think about setting out on her journey until she'd eaten enough to easily make five or six normal breakfasts. She was so stuffed, even a slow amble gave her a stitch in her side. This is going to slow me down, she realized. And she couldn't exactly afford to be slowed down. It would take her about a week to reach the tomb traveling at her normal speed ... more, the slower she got, and the slower she got, the fatter she'd be when she got there. And fat thieves soon found themselves in tight spots on the job. Hmm, figure seven days, plus at least three... maybe if I sleep less, and walk more--

"Well, well. I didn't know you'd gotten knocked up."

Snip looked up crossly into the smirking face of One-Eyed Rance, the handsome but annoying and suave but annoying human safecracker she'd paired up with on a couple of occasions -- in bed, of course, she'd never sully herself professionally with such a rank amateur.

"I'm not," she snapped.

His amethyst eyes twinkled with amusement. He had two eyes -- he only called himself 'One-Eyed' because it confused the people looking for him. "Oh, I know. The whole inn was buzzing about the way you demolished the menu last night -- and again this morning, if looks don't deceive. Isn't it hard to walk?"

"I'll make do," she said shortly.

They walked on in silence for a while as the sun rose higher in the sky and the dew burned off, the sound of distant birdsong all that met their ears.

"I'd rather handle this on my own, if you don't mind," Snip said when it became obvious he wasn't going to leave.

"Oh, the old orc's tomb, that thing? You can be my guest, when we come to that. I certainly don't care to muck around in some moldy old crypt when the rich keep such clean houses. Until then, it's everybody's road."

"Not the space around me. That's my road," Snip explained, pulling out a few knives, "and here and here are my bodyguards, so I suggest you -- ooh!" Her stomach gurgled loudly.

"Hungry already?" Rance raised one coal-black eyebrow.

"Hell. I thought I'd be at least to Stonewood by the time I needed to eat again. Now I'll have to look for an orchard or something."

She was about to turn off the road when she sensed something flying at her, and caught it on a dagger without looking. It turned out to be a sweet roll. She looked back at Rance.

"I suspected you might need a little something extra along the way," he shrugged. "Or a lot of something. Honestly, you don't think you're going to be able to carry enough supplies to get all that way on your own, do you? You'll be chewing your own arms off halfway across the Gray Plains."

Snip munched the sweet roll sullenly. The obnoxious thing was, he was right. "And I suppose you're coming just out of the kindness of your own heart?"

He laughed. "Of course not! You're my friend, Snip, I don't want to see you starve in the wilderness." He grinned cruelly. "But you're also one of the best thieves in Squallhirst, and that means you're one of my competitors. It can hardly hurt my own bottom line if I fatten up those quick little fingers of yours a bit, now can it?"

Snip gulped.
131.title: The Greatest Adventure Is What Lies Ahead...

choices: Snip demands a cut of the profits.
The two journey onward, getting in sight of the tomb.
1311.content:
A crowd of toughs gathered around, their eyes scarcely believing what they were witnessing. Still, that didn't keep the grins from all their faces.

Snip gulped down two more flagons of ale, her belly distending as she did so, gobbling up a double helping of Warg ribs and a meat pie shortly after that.

And she still wasn't done.

Rance stood by, idly holding out his hand to those toughs foolhardy enough to bet against Snip's gluttony.

Yes, Rance thought to himself, he had made a fine amount of coin off of his competitor's misfortune.

"BURRRAAAAAAAAPPP! Ooooh...." Snip moaned as she finished her last plate of fried krullers, her recently purchased outfit, several sizes larger than the one she had set out on this quest with.

Rance chuckled and patted her gut, enjoying the groan that elicited and the small belch after that.

"Show's over folks, I'm afraid this little one has truly bitten off more than she could chew. But be sure to return tomorrow morning for her breakfast feast."

The toughs dispersed and Snip glared at Rance.

"What? I told you you're condition would help me if you had a bit more weight on you."
1311.title: Several days later...

choices: Word spreads, the scam fails, and they reach Tombside penniless.
Other towns still fall for it, and they reach Tombside with buckets of cash.
13111.content:
"L-listen," Snip said, flopping prone on the bed, "if you're going to be running bets at my figure's expense, I want a cut of the action."

"Hey, nobody's forcing you to eat. I'm just making a little coin off what happens to be going on."

"I'm what's going on!"

"Exactly. Besides, I had to pay the inn to keep the food coming, and you do want your food, don't you?"

"I never want to eat again," Snip moaned, loosening her pants.

"You say that every night," Rance said with a wink.

"Well, tonight I mean it! No more eating until you give me a share!"

"Ha! You'll be chewing on the headboard by midnight."

Snip shot him a sour look. The big jerk was probably right, though. She sighed. "At least give me something so I can get my thieving gear re-tailored. That's a lot more expensive than these peasant travel clothes, you know!"

"Fine, but let's wait until we get a little closer to the tomb. No sense in paying for it twice, right?"

"And I want at least fifty percent of the profits, too."

"I told you already, you're eating fifty percent of the profits already!"

"Don't play stupid. I mean net. What I'm eating is gross."

"You're telling me. Fine, tell you what. You can have whatever we make tomorrow morning. That's fair, right?"

"I guess," Snip said suspiciously.

-----

The next day, following breakfast, Snip stormed -- well, waddle-stormed -- out of the inn in a foul mood. Her stomach was full to bursting once more, but her purse was remarkably svelte.

"Can't believe none of those idiots wanted to bet..." she muttered.

Rance shrugged. "Well, what do you expect? They saw the way you ate yesterday. None of them wanted to lose any more money on the Halfling-and-a-Half."

Snip sighed. Well, they still had a ways before reaching the town of Tombside.
13111.title: A Fat Purse

choices: Snip finds a magical banquet in the tomb, leaving Rance to go ahead alone.
They find the diamonds and get them out of the tomb.
131111.content:
Rance was just as hungry as Snip, though not for food.

No, Rance was hungry the glitter of gold, the gleam of rubies, and the shine of diamonds. Snip was just starving, her body even wider than it had been the past week, though it hadn't been a pleasurable experience. In the absence of well-cooked meals and beer, Snip's cure took it upon itself to make her eat any plant, berry, root, or odd liquid they came upon.

Now the pair were before Tombside, the sheer black monument to the grand Orc King of old looming over them. Rance's fine clothes were ruined though his knives were as sharp as ever. Snip had no knives any more, or thieving gear of any sort, the thief having sold them for coin to buy as much food as she could.

All of that food saw her through a single day's breakfast and lunch.

But she did have her enlarged thieving gear, though it was starting to tear and she feared if she bent over her ponderous rear would split the leather backside of her pants in two.

"Let us hurry and gather that treasure, then we'll live and feast like kings!" Rance exclaimed.

Snip nodded, rubbing her growling stomach.

She just had to tough it out through this old tomb, grab the largest diamonds she could for her old lovers, and get this damned curse removed, then she could resume the life that had been put on hold thanks to magic.

Waddling on ahead of Rance, she went into the shadowy entrance of the tomb, her partner following behind.
131111.title: Word spreads...

choices: Snip is too fat to get past a trap, and is stuck.
Snip reaches the diamonds with no trouble.
131112.content:
From then on, the two thieves only placed bets on the first night. As the two thieves approached the looming edifice of Tombside, Rance was very happy, his purse bulging with his proceeds. Snip, on the other hand, was far less happy. Her purse had definitely expanded less than, well...

The continual influx of winnings had allowed Snip to keep her gear in good repair and buy a few new tools, but also to stuff herself silly with the most fattening treats at will. Now her round gut and wobbling backside were straining her third new set of thieving clothes.

Snip had been ignoring Rance's smirks as she struggled to lace her boots or puffed up a flight of stairs, but the fattened halfling was worried about how her girth would affect her delve into Tombside. But she had to try now, she knew, heaving herself up after her fifth course of breakfast at the last inn. Before long, she'd be too wide to fit through the tomb's door...
131112.title: Other towns still fall for it, and they reach T...

choices: They enter the buffet, and actually find out something useful!
Snip eats enough to close the buffet for the day and earn herself a life ban.
1311121.content:
"So, Snip..."

"Yeah?"

"What's the deal with Tombside? Who builds a town around a creepy tomb?"

"You know, I'm really not sure..."

But as they walked through the main gate, the question was answered. Glowing crystals lit the cavern town, revealing a bustling panorama of urban activity. There were more vendors on the main drag of this town than the last three she'd been in, but they all seemed to be catering to entertainment. Gambling houses, brothels, taverns, theaters, sideshows... And they all seemed to center around the fabled, legendary Tomb of the Orc King, the one orc warlord who had managed to unite his race, and whose laws and edicts influenced orcish culture even today, whether it was the more placid orcs and half-orcs who assimilated into civilization, or the more feral tribes of orcs out in the wilderness. Rance scratched his head as he looked down the street to the actual tomb... Which seemed to have guards around it. "This could be a little more complicated than just going into some dusty old dead guy's house and stealing his stuff... What's the plan, Snip?"

After a few moments of silence, he looked down to the plumped-up halfling, who seemed to be staring off into the distance. "Uh. Snip?" The rakish rogue waved his hand in front of her face to see if he could snap her out of the trance, but to no avail. What sinister force had her in its thrall? He looked to where Snip was gazing, and understood immediately.

A large sign displaying the letters "BLURG'S 24-HOUR ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT BUFFET - TRY OUR FAMOUS BARBECUE RIBS! THEY'RE ORC KING GOOD!". Devious. Snip was already moving towards the door, and he doubted he could stop her...
1311121.title: Tourist Trap

choices: "'Victory's in the cards'... We should look in the gambling houses!"
"It mentions a tortoise.  Maybe that's a clue!"
13111211.content:
Blurg's wasn't exactly the classiest place, but one thing you say about it...it had atmosphere. Sort of.

"Let's see," Rance pondered, examining the goods behind the prize counter. "Forty-five more tickets and I can get a +1 Ring of Pez Dispensing..."

He wandered down the row of games, novelties, and singing clockwork orcs. He really didn't need any of the prizes, but he had to do something to kill time until his halfling companion finally exhausted her ability to shovel pork into her face.

"Come on, young fellow!" barked a gnome, gesturing to an array of holes and circular barriers behind him. "Try your luck with the fabled Orb of Skee!"

As he passed the ball pit, a young woman with milky skin and eyes like crystal pools popped up, plastic balls falling from her flaxen hair. "I have not seen such a fine figure of a man in many a day," she cooed. "Come, my love, and frolic with me, for I have a way with balls you shall not soon forget."

"Nay, nymph," Rance laughed. "I know of your kind, and I have no wish to be dragged under and drowned by the likes of you!"

The pit nymph hissed and sank back under the balls. Rance sighed as he wandered back to check on Snip. What a waste of a saucy wench!

Speaking of saucy wenches, the halfling definitely qualified at this point. Buried in her I-don't-know-how-many-th basket of juicy pork ribs, she was an absolute mess, both her face and her hands smeared with the tangy sauce. Rance coughed.

"I don't suppose you're almost done?"

"Not--" She bit down on a large rib. "--effumph--" She had it mostly stripped of meat. "-cloffth."

"Ah, well," Rance said, sitting down. He had little desire to waste more coin on the games. Instead he picked up a crayon and began doing the activities on the placemat.

It was some time later that Snip finally dropped the last bone into the basket and sat back with a groan, feeling so full of pork she was sure that a skilled enough necromancer could have reanimated the contents of her stomach into one whole pig.

"Close now?" Rance asked.

Snip burped. "Done."

"Good. Because I believe I've found something of use to us." He held up the placemat. "Look at this! It's a map of the tomb!"

"That's just a maze for kids," Snip sneered.

"Perhaps," Rance admitted. "But don't most placemats have a kernal of truth to them? I believe this may be the clue we need... all we have to do is solve the maze and follow the clues here."

"Clues?" Snip asked, intrigued. "Let me see that. Oh! It's a poem!"

"You didn't see that on yours?" Rance glanced at Snip's placemat. It was a morass of sauce. "Hmm, point taken."

Snip licked her fingers clean and took the paper.

When one eats a tortoise one does not start from the head
And a frontal charge upon an orc will quickly leave one dead
It will be hard
To brave the guards
And victory's only in the cards,
For those who scorned the mouth and go the other way instead

"Obviously there's some kind of back entrance," Snip mused. "That much is clear."

"But where? That's the question," Rance said. "It can't be easy to find."

"Hmm..." Snip said.
13111211.title: Saucy Wench

choices: Mariska grab the Wand of Compulsion!
Mariska glowing. She's a goddess in disguise and is here to punish Morissa!
Scales. Mariska was a dragon?!
14.content:
Morissa Thorne cackled as she observed the frightened gleam in her latest victim's eyes.

Oh this one had put up quite the fight but now, after a few nibbles, the peasant woman was starting to falter. Her movements were faltering and her eyes losing that spark of defiance that had first drawn Morissa to her.

She loved defiant blood, it was always so tasty!

Grasping her Wand of Compulsion, she turned it on her victim.

"What is your name, woman?"

"Mariska," the woman replied.

"Mariska...I like it. Pity it will be nothing but memory in a few moments."

Setting her magical item down, Morissa approached, fangs extending to their utmost as she prepared to feast on the young woman's lifeblood. The fangs were just about to pierce the skin when Morissa saw the spark of defiance flare up again, the woman rolling away.

Morissa's eyes widened as she saw...
14.title: Morissa Thorne

choices: "Find a kind-hearted young man and fall in love"
"Become my willing, loving slave"
"Become addicted to cow's blood, drink all of it you can and drink nothing else"
141.content:
Mariska's shaky hand held the wand firmly. "Stop" She ordered with a firm voice.

Morissa's movements stopped instantaneously, she was frozen in mid step. She screamed internally at this stupid peasant. How dare she defy her!

Mariska stood up, keeping the wand pointed at the vampire in front of her. "Tell me how the wand works" She ordered.

Morissa gritted her teeth in defiance, trying to stop the words from escaping her lips. Her efforts were in vain.

"As long as the wand is pointed at a sapient being, said sapient being must do anything the holder of the wand demands." She gasped. "In addition, the commands effects will remain indefinitely after-wards, it can change the very heart and soul" her eyes widened in fear as she spoke. She could see the look of triumph in the stupid peasant's eyes.

"Good, good" said Mariska with a faint smile. "Because I have some things I'd love for you to do..."
141.title: Mariska grab the Wand of Compulsion!

choices: Try to get the wand back so she can reverse the effects.
Seek out a powerful wizard and beg for help.
1413.content:
"Cow's blood? You expect me to drink such filthy, low-class stuff? I'll never --- never -- !!"

Morissa gasped as the compulsion took hold. Suddenly, her mind was filled with thoughts of gallons of warm, pulsing blood, thick with the taste of raw beef. Thundering hooves and frightened lowing filled her ears.

Cow. I've got to have cow!

Shoving the woman in front of her aside, as if in a dream, she stumbled forward. The peasants kept dairy herds, she knew. If she sent her servants now, she could have a cow here within the hour. Her throat felt so parched, and only one thing could quench the thirst...

With one great, guttural moo, her mind went blank.

--------

Morissa came to her senses some time later, feeling sick and heavy. She was in her bedchamber, tangled in the sheets, her powder-white body completely nude.

And yet, no longer powder-white, for as she looked down at herself she realized that she was flushed almost to the color of a tomato, and her stomach was so distended it could have been mistaken for one. She coughed and sputtered, spitting up a few drops of blood. She was so full that lying on her back made it hard to breathe, though she didn't technically need to.

She rolled over onto her side, feeling the immense amount of liquid sloshing around inside her belly and guts like a waterbed. Lying next to the bed, legs in the air, was a dead cow.

Don't tell me I drank the whole thing myself, Morissa thought. She belched, and another thin stream of blood dribbled down her cheek.

With a snap of her fingers, she summoned her phantasmal servants to clean the bedchamber, remove the dried-out cow, and scrub her clean. When they'd finished, she slipped into her loosest robe and, with some difficulty, sat up, sloshing audibly.

"Ugh," she grunted miserably.

The worst part was, in the back of her mind, she knew the compulsion would return. She shuddered, sloshing again as she did so.
1413.title: Have a Cow, Man

choices: Mariska feels the compulsion again but Lura's magic stops her from indulging.
Lura has cooked her a mighty feast the next day.
14132.content:
Mariska knew that getting the wand back in her bloated form was out of the question, especially once she learned that the clever village wench had used it on her servants, making them teleport her castle far away from the village. So that left her with only one option: visiting Lura Collan, a powerful wizard she had tried to toy with seven decades ago, ending in her stuck in the form of a pig for a month.

So, adopting her most apologetic expression, she set out for the wizard's tower with her servants, occasionally stopping for cows along the way, which explained, when the elven Lura opened her tower door, she saw a chubby vampire with a tubby rear end, a pot-belly that was on the verge of becoming a gut, and a round face.

"Oh great Lura, I require your assistance!"

Lura chuckled inwardly, though outwardly she allowed herself to delight in this undead creature's new figure. It was one of her quirks, as wizard's were often guilty of having them, and one that always brought her heart to hammering whenever she spied a woman's over-fed figure or expanding body. Of her countless female lover's over the centuries, not a one had left her without an extra fifty to a hundred, and in one dwarf's case five hundred, pounds courtesy of Lura's skills in the kitchen and magical prowess.

"Why should I help you?"

"My soul's bond that I will not harm a sentient being for a century, feasting on animals only."

"Are you really so desperate to lose this weight?"

"It's not the weight! It's a damned compulsion from the Wand of Compulsion!"

"Solan's great wand? I won't ask how you came about it. Tricky to dispel but manageable. Send your servants back to your lair and come stay with me and I'll end your compulsion along with your promised soul bond."

Mariska nodded and soon entered the tower, wondering, for a brief moment, if she would have been better off going to grab the wand from the wench instead.
14132.title: Seek out a powerful wizard and beg for help.

choices: Mariska is stuffed day after day, as Lura "searches for a cure".
Something else.
141322.content:
The next evening, the portly vampire arose from the (rather large) coffin Lura had thoughtfully provided for her in the tower's basement.Once the vampire had seemed to float up from her resting place, but now...

"Unng, oof!" Mariska grunted as she clambered out of her coffin, her gut squishing into rolls and her rear quivering. How long before Lura could help her, and how large would she grow?

Mariska strode up the tower's stairs, trying to ignore her thighs brushing together. She was trying to figure out a diplomatic, yet forceful way to get Lura to speed up whatever she was doing, when it hit her. Something she hadn't thought of in centuries. Food.

The smell of a hundred dishes, each more wondrous that the last, assaulted her. What was going on? Vampires don't eat food... Her cloudy certainty didn't stop her from chasing the delightful odor up the stairs.

Waiting at the top of the stairs was a huge dining table, groaning under the weight of the food piled atop it. Her hunger intensified to dizzying levels This is just like with the cows! Was the last thought she had before everything faded to black.

**********

When Mariska regained her senses, she was sprawled atop the huge table, now covered in empty plates. Her stomach was again massively bloated, towering over her packed with solids, not liquid. The vampire moaned, and belched explosively. The foreign sensation of being stuffed full of food overwhelmed her undead senses; she squirmed back and forth but felt helpless to move or even summon a servant spell. A shadow passed over her, and Mariska's eyes flickered open.

Lura stood over her, the grinning wizardess reaching out to smooth back the fattened vampire's hair. "I knew the experiment would work!"

"W-Wha...*belch*" was all Mariska could manage.

"The compulsion is too strong for me to just cancel, so I tried to change the focus." Her hands traced over the vast arc of Mariska's belly. "And I was able to change in from cow blood to cow meat during the day, and from cow meat to food in general - that last part took all night!"

Mariska's eyes flickered over to the window Lura was standing in front of. She could see dawn approaching. I was eating... all night?! Mariska groaned wordlessly, which only seemed to widen Lura's smile.

"Weeell, now that I know how do affect the compulsion, I can work on lessening the effects. And now that you're eating my delicious food..." Mariska felt a tremble pass through her. "I can keep you here to experiment on instead of having you roam the land, looking for livestock." Mariska felt there was a slight gap in the wizardess's logic, but was too bloated and woozy to voice a protest. With a gesture, Lura levitated the bloated vampire and guided her downstairs into the coffin.

"Don't worry dear, this will all be over before much longer!" The coffin's lid closed, barely able to fit over her obese stomach.

Mariska moaned again, her hands tracing across the bloated ball of her gut as the sun's rising slowly made her drift off to sleep. This was no cure! How much larger would she get, stuffed full of fattening foods instead of blood?

Lura giggled widely, her cheeks flushed. The spells had been hard work, but the reward had been watching a gorgeous elven babe stuff herself to a level only something with an undead creature's dulled pain receptors could manage. Oh yes, she would 'cure' Mariska. She'd solve all of her problems, all right...
141322.title: Lura has cooked her a mighty feast the next day.

choices: Get something to eat! How do you even feed this body?
Assemble minions! I need to rebuild my empire!
Seek out the dark gift! I need to feel the rush of undeath again!
142.content:
Morissa was blown back in an explosion of golden light, tearing up the finely decorated chambers where she preferred to feed on her victims, pulling paintings off the wall, blowing over artifacts coerced from their owners by Morissa's ever-useful wand of compulsion, and making the curtains whip like there was a hurricane in the room.

Morissa righted herself quickly, and as the light died away, she beheld the true form of her supposed victim.

"Oops," said Morissa.

There, floating two inches off the ground, was Mariska, reborn as a beautiful angel of steel. Golden light flooded her eyes and mout, and large silver wings stretched out beside her. Her gaze turned to the vampiress, and she spoke in a voice that filled the room like molten gold. "OOPS, INDEED," she said.

Trying to keep her eyes locked on the strange creature as long as possible, Morissa glanced toward her wand of compulsion, on the floor a few feet away, and began a slow, stealthy sidle over toward it.

The angel continued to speak. "MORISSA THORNE," She said, raising an accusatory finger to the vampire, "I AM THE MAGIC EATER, ENVOY OF THE GREAT KIOS, GODDESS OF JUSTICE AND BALANCE. YOUR ACTIONS HAVE GONE UNCHECKED FOR TOO LONG. THE SCALES MUST BE BALANCED. PREPARE YOURSELF."

Morissa made a quick tumble, snatching her wand from the ground, and immediately firing it's beam toward the strange angel. Even though Morissa was fast, the Magic Eater was immediate, right up next to Morissa before she even realized it had moved. The wand's beam flew harmlessly into the ground. Morissa watched helplessly as the steel woman effortlessly wrested the wand from her hand, and brought it close to her face. "NOT THIS TIME," she said, snapping like a twig between her fingers. The wand exploded in a torrent of blue-green mist, with an otherworldly glow. The Magic Eater closed her eyes, and took a slow, deep breath, inhaling all of the mist into her glowing mouth.

Morissa staggered back in confusion and horror as the strange creature turned to face her. As it advanced, she couldn't help noticing that her attacker's steel curves had filled out somewhat. Her thighs were thicker, her hips were wider, and her stomach wasn't nearly as sculpted. The now-voluptuous creature moved slowly toward the shellshocked vampire girl. Morissa felt the Magic Eater's vice grip tighten on her shoulders, lifting her up off the ground. The Magic Eater stared deep into her with it's glowing eyes, and then deeply inhaled. Moriss screamed as an otherworldly heat filled her body, her vision filled with red.

And then, suddenly, it was over. Morissa crumpled to the ground, as the last of the magic drained from her. She looked up at the face of the Magic Eater, who was licking her lips. Her softened stomach had inflated to a roll of steel fat, resting comfortably on her generous, child bearing hips. The creature seemed almost preoccupied with itself, cradling it's belly fondly.

Morissa, still lying broken on the floor, looked down at her hands. The color had rushed back into her eerily pale skin, and she felt a warmth from within herself. "I'm..." She said, weakly.

"ALIVE," the Magic Eater said, "WELCOME TO THE HUMAN RACE, MORISSA THORNE."

A zap of energy, and the chubby angel was gone.

Morissa was left on the floor of her chambers, broken. And human.

----------

So what will a newly de-vampired human do?
142.title: Judge and Jury

choices: Continue.
1423.content:
It took a moment for the shaking reborn human to realize that the deep thumping sounding throughout the room was the sound of her own heart, once again pumping lifeblood through her veins. She squinted and looked at her open palms, stretching out her fingers and then pulling them back in to make a pair of fists.

“How long has it been...”, muttered Morissa as she sat, staring in disbelief at herself in a mirror across from her that had fell and broken from the actions of the Magic Eater. A ragged crack shot straight up, dividing her flushed face in half. She reached a hand up to feel her pink flesh, her fingers darting away when the touch brought no coldness.

She prodded and inspected her newly living body for several minutes, this unfamiliar feeling bringing in curious sensations with each touch.

“...I...I hate this. The warmth, it...I cannot stay like this! I must regain my vampire abilities. I must...”.

Morissa nodded briskly to herself, standing up in the middle of the trashed living room. The intervention from that Angel had made a wreck of her property; curtains ripped, books strewn across the floor, paintings either crooked or fallen. Such a mess, thought Morissa. With steady steps she made her way to the cabinets across the room, searching for any coins that she could pocket. It was her home, of course, but Morissa knew in her beating heart that it would be awhile before she returned.

With the coins packed away safely, she turned and headed for the entryway to the manor. A quick look back at the disheveled room did nothing but further her need to get on her way. Where exactly Morissa was headed, she wasn't too sure of herself. She just knew that she had to find another vampire somewhere, and soon, else she go mad.

Stepping out into the sun was...to say the least, frightening for Morissa. She braced her arms over her face, protecting herself from the rays of the sun...only to remember that she was living. “Oh, right...I'm mortal. Daylight won't hurt me...”.

Even so, she took ginger steps across the dirt walkway, wary eyes looking to and fro as she got a hold of her surroundings. There was a minor chill to the air due to the manor being located at the foot of a range of mountains. Ignoring the chill, Morissa made her way down the trail, eying a lone red apple that hung from a tree. She grabbed at it, the crisp fruit being the first food she had laid eyes on since changing. She flashed her teeth and opened her mouth, planting the apple just below her top row of teeth. Without thinking she stabbed her teeth into the apple, attempting to suck the juice from the apple.

After a moment, Morissa blinked and paused, glancing down at the apple punctured on her teeth. With a roll of her eyes and a loud sigh, she shifted the apple and took a bite from the fruit this time. The sweet taste of the apple's flesh brought on a swath of flavor to Morissa's palate, and she found herself taking several more bites until the core remained.

“The taste of apples...I'd forgotten how sweet they are!” Morissa let out a small snicker, feeling a smidgen more comfortable after eating that apple. With a snack taken care of, she once again started walking, the end of the road her destination for the time being.
1423.title: Back To Life

choices: Stay and head for the coven.
Ride with the man to the harbor.
14231.content:
Morissa found the walk down the trail to be quite relaxing and, before she knew it, she had reached the end of the trail only to walk out onto a wide dirt road, marred with imprints of horse hooves and straight lines. Such a cart to make those kind of tracks was coming from the right, Morissa noticed, its rider a grizzled looking gentlemen who was wearing some drab farming clothes and a straw hat.

“A farmer? Hmm. Perhaps I could hitch a ride from this fellow,” mused Morissa as the cart came ever closer to her. “I've got the coin, and besides, what kind of man would leave a lovely woman like myself standing on the side of a dirt road?”

With that thought, Morissa planted a kind smile on her lips and calmly strode up to the man and his horses, waving a hand to the man as he looked down at her. “Hello, good sir! Beautiful day for a ride, is it not?”

The man grunted and shrugged his thick shoulders, looking around at the fields and trees. “Aye, I 'spose one could say so...if the circumstances were different.” He spat away from Morissa and rubbed a hand across his lips. “I'm sellin' the last stash of my feed n' supplies to the village up this road. The land's not doin' too well, unfortunately. Some damn vampire coven has decided to take roost up in the waterfall caverns. They've been comin' down and takin' people every other night it seems, and I'm not stickin' around for their chance at me!” The man paused for a moment and spat once more to the side of his cart.

“I'm headin' for the coast, up to that fancy harbor town. Can't remember the name at the moment, but it's up that way, trust me! Gonna get gold to buy me a ship and sail away from the bloody nonsense goin' on around here...” The man sighed and looked down at Morissa, his wrinkled face studying her own. “Can't think a lady such as yerself would stick 'round these parts. Might be you want'a come along with me, aye? Could probably find good work at that harbor...”

Morissa thought for a moment, digesting all the information this old man had just given her. "I can stay and seek out that coven...surely they would know who I am and would gladly restore me to undeath...but, perhaps I should not mingle with them. I am Morissa Thorne, of course! There must surely be a suitor with higher standing nearby a wealthy location such as this harbor the man speaks of..."

Morissa's fangs glanced off the wall of overlapping golden scales. Hissing in surprise, she recoiled from the great wyrm uncoiling itself in front of her, ripping off the last shreds of the peasant's simple clothes.

"What an annoyance," the dragon said in a voice like magma and honey stirred together. "I do so hate to have my little incognito excursions interrupted."

She had unwrapped herself fully now, filling the front hall of Morissa's castle, one massive coil smashing the long oak table where a few moments earlier a hungry vampire had been wining and dining her "unsuspecting" conquest. The beast was immense. Morissa attempted to back up, only to find herself blocked by one leathery wing the size of a galleon's mainsail.

"Leave me, dragon!" Morissa snarled, snatching up the wand and aiming it at the scaly face. The dragon laughed, plucked up the wand as one might pluck a toothpick, and snapped it in half. If it had been possible for Morissa to turned any paler, she would have done so.

"Th-this has obviously been a misunderstanding," she stammered. "Leave now, and I'll spare you!"

"Spare me your empty threats, if you're going to spare me anything. I can't stand you little gnats, running around, turning perfectly tasty humans into more of you." The dragon blew a blast of superheated air into Morissa's face. "I believe I'll take this castle for the trouble."

"But -- but I'm sure you don't want my castle," Morissa said hastily. "It's too small for a creature of your magnificent bulk--"

The dragon kicked out one of the walls. Morissa heard the crunch and snap of her skeletal servants being crushed into powder by the collapse of a good portion of the east wing.

"Now, little vampire, I believe you were about to have a little nip from me?" the dragon asked jovially.

"No -- no, of course not --"

The dragon chuckle. "Now, don't be shy. Come! Drink your fill!"

One huge claw seized Morissa and shoved her face-first into the dragon's flank, forcing her down until her fangs burst painfully through the scales. Suddenly, hot dragon blood flowed into Morissa's throat. It was like drinking liquid fire, and yet somehow, underneath it all, there were rich tones and subtle flavors as well. It poured into Morissa's belly like white-hot rubies.

"Glmp!" she said, fighting the claw. "Glmph! Mmph!" High-pressure jets of blood forced themselves into her faster than she could guzzle them down, leaking out around her lips and dribbling to the floor, where they smoked and steamed on the ancient tile. Her stomach was growing full and taut, and yet she knew she hadn't yet tasted one thousandth of all the blood in the wyrm's monstrous body.

Just when she was resigning herself to drinking until she burst, the dragon yanked her off again and set her back down roughly. She wobbled, feeling her innards slosh uncomfortably. She was bloated to the point of repletion, flushed tomato-red, full as a tick.

"How did you like your snack?" the dragon asked. Morissa belched wetly through charred, cracked lips.

"Good. Now, here is what happens next--"

Sure enough it was, as the belly fat squished and bulged underneath her hands as she beheld as her belly was of such size, it possessed both a paunch and a haunch for the former to rest upon. Then again, it was a bit hard to see past her large, fat breasts which could no longer keep a pert shape and rested against the top of her belly's curve. Her ass, however, seemed to prove the centerpiece as it sunk into an impressive impression in the fine mattress of the bed. As she got up to look at it herself in the mirror closer, Morissa could see just how far out from her body, as well as it's impressive, full diameter and how much it jiggled as she stood up. Her pale face flushed red in embarrassment and rage as she beheld her new body. Her once elegant, refined figure now was positively ruined! And all because of a damned dragon. As much as she wanted to punish "Mariska" she knew that there was no chance in hell that she could ever slay a dragon. She was not some shining Paladin of The Blessed who could take off her head with a simple crack of her sword but if she was, ohh she would-

There was a pregnant pause as Morissa thought to herself. Of course! She may not have had the power to stand against a Dragon, but if the annals of myth and history books she had read in her long years proved to be true, a hero of good intent could slay that dammed dragon. She would find such a man, someone good and pure and gullible and lead whoever it may be onward to garner the power to slay Mariska and get her revenge. A wicked fanged smile slowly formed on Morissa's pale face as she imagined the look on Mariska's decapitated head as her eye stared up, cold and dead, at the women she never should have wronged. The elvish vampiress brought a hand up to her mouth and laughed crulely as she continued to daydream of her playing the role of an innocent accursed maiden who would help lead this fool-hero to victory!

However her laughter was interrupted as she moaned aloud, feeling Natasha's magical fingers penetrate the silence...among other things. She closed her eyes halfway and eyed the enthralled beauty with lust as she smiled playfully, her fangs visible even as her mouth remained closed.

Hero searching could wait, Morissa thought as, despite her new, tubby body, she glided back into bed and once more, she indulged in her carnal desires.

Morissa set out in the morning. Instead of her favourite cloak (Which she, of course outgrew), she took to wearing a simple, but still well designed petticoat with some fine leather boots. Her coat, despite being crafted for her over a good few days to match her figure, was still a bit tight and she felt embarrassed that it seemed to show off her ponderous and jiggly belly. The buttons struggled just to come together fully over her fat breasts, which jiggled modestly underneath. Her trousers also felt painfully tight as her thick, fat legs felt constrained in the fabric as her thighs and upper legs rubbed against the material and her exceptional rear stretched and tightened the poor article in back, as if calling attention to any passing suitors with it's sultry and large shape. As much as she enjoyed her wealth and elegance, she did not lack the sense to know just what an adventure would call for. It would be quite a journey, but she knew that would only help make the end result of her plan for vengeance much more satisfying. She wore a cowl over her head to help hide her piercing, cat like red eyes. She didn't want to risk drawing attention to herself, even if no one would really expect to see a vampire on an overcast day, never mind in broad daylight. Morissa mused to herself at how easy it was for normal mortals to so quickly assume that Vampires shriveled and died in the sun. In reality, Vampires stayed to the night due to the cover of stealth darkness brought about and avoided sun due to the fact it interfered with their innate powers, such as shape-shifting into bats or mist and regeneration. Whatever helped to give them hope, she mused once more.

The nearest township, Ngvar, rested a few mere miles by foot, nestled between burgeoning farmlands and plentiful forestation. It was said that the reason the town itself housed so many trees within itself was because as it was founded and roads were being paved, trees would magically spring from specific spots in the ground and no matter how many of them were cut down for lumber, another would spring up in that same spot. The founding villagers essentially gave up and since built the village around the trees. Since then, the people of Ngvar established a belief of living alongside nature, rather than forcing it to obey their whims and respected the trees and animals that lived within the town's provinces. Morissa found this ideology quaint.

The elven vampire looked studiously at the people from beneath her cowl. Somewhere, somehow, she would find a fitting fighter to aid her. Her boots splashed against thin puddles of water on the ground as she pondered weather or not she would find someone fitting for the task of dragonslaying. True, it would take a great investment of her time, but as both an elf and a vampire she had much to afford. Mifflemix Mistweeze Zipple, better known as Miffie to her mother and master in the arcane arts, the legendary human mage Kara Skyrider, was currently doing her best to study her newest spell.

As far as spells went, it was a bit mundane, being a simple transformation spell.

Reading the words again, Miffie nodded, standing up to her full height of one foot and spoke the words out loud.

In a flash the tiny pixie was now a blue-feathered duck.

"Well, that was easy," Miffie muttered.

She knew why she was now dealing with entry level spells when she was at least an intermediate level mage.

It had all started with the cupcakes...

Kara was well aware of her daughter's sweet tooth and so kept her away from human-sized portions. But her diligence could only extend so far, especially once she was called away to deal with a rampaging dragon.

Miffie had flown towards the town bakery and noticed the multitude of cupcakes, her mouth watering.

She wanted them now!

Unfortunately, the bakery was closed for the evening so Miffie resorted to the latest spell her master had taught her.

What was to be a single burst of focused energy to slice through the metal lock ended up blasting half the bakery away. Luckily there had been no people inside but Miffie lost her chance at trying the cupcakes and had been punished by Kara with going back to square one with magic lessons.

It had shamed Miffie, shamed her mother, and shamed her taste-buds, because she really did want those muffins.

Still, the worst part was the look of sorrow in her mother's eyes.

Kara had found Miffie as a baby pixie and raised her like a daughter and to see the woman she saw as both mother and mentor suffer because of what she did hurt worse than all of the rest of her suffering combined.

Still, their relationship was improving and now, a full six months since the cupcake incident, things were almost back to normal.

Miffie was drawn out of her thoughts by her mother entering her chamber, Miffie again drawn to how ageless she looked, appearing the same now as she did all those decades ago.

Kara Skyrider had long black hair, serious dark eyes, and lips that belied the seriousness in her gaze. She was often smiling or joking and it was this part of her more than any other that Miffie had imitated.

Slim and toned, Kara looked more like a warrior than a mage, but she often told Miffie that appearances were nothing. What mattered was the inner self.

Smiling as she approached, Kara gently picked up Miffie.

"You've been doing so well in your studies I believe a reward is in order."

"Are we going to resume my more advanced training?"

"No, I was thinking more of a treat, something you love."

Miffie wriggled around in her palm, smiling as Kara pointed her free hand towards the table. With a blast of energy, a large cupcake appeared, topped with chocolate frosting.

It was large even to Kara's eyes and she smiled as her daughter's joy.

"Now don't eat too much of it at once Miffie, alright?"

"Don't worry mother, I won't!"

She flew towards the table and chomped a chunk out of the cupcake.

Yes, Miffie thought as she continued to eat, things are definitely looking up for me.

Miffie moaned, adjusting her daisy-petal skirt. She hadn't meant to eat the whole thing, she really hadn't, but it had just been so good! So it was an equally unimaginable standard for her to adhere to!

Using itself to brush the dirt from the floor and into its spellbound companion, the dustpan, the broom made the household chores so much easier on little Miffie- the pixie in question deeming the endless hours she would have spent cleaning much better suited to the fortification of her skills in Magicka.

Soon enough the tiny hat began to shrink to Miffie-size and the tiny figure placed it atop her blue head of hair. Perhaps a little conjuration was in order?

A cupcake sized less than the spread of her palm appeared in Miffie's hands, dressed not unlike her first. Unwrapping the cup from the cake, Miffie devilishly devoured her treat for being such a good little mage. Begin able to conjure up her favorite treat at little less than will sure was handy.

However she knew at the continuing grumbling of her belly that enough was enough ("Uugh, I sound like Mother!") She loved chocolate. Loved chocolate. But she also wasn't a fan of straining her wings trying to fly around a whopper of a Miffie. Mother had said that control was a big part of being a Mage...

But who said she couldn't cheat every now and then when it came to the whole "control" thing, anyway?

Miffie recalled the spell that her mother had taught her some days ago, having only tried it once or twice since then. She recited the words and focused herself just as her mother had instructed her to...
1511121.title: Practice, practice, practice!

choices: -- she walked in on Miffie still eating!  Bus-ted!
-- she found her seemingly innocent daughter stuffed full of "magic".
15111211.content:
WHUMPH! Miffie felt as though she'd just been socked in the gut. Her little stomach filled up like a water balloon on a high-pressure tap, and in the matter of seconds, she felt fuller than she'd ever been in her life.

"Ook," she hiccuped, prodding her distended belly. It was taut and quivering, and even bigger than it had been after her last cupcake pig-out. This spell was certainly realistic. She wondered what was in there. Magical phantasms? Mental illusions? Whatever it was, it sure did feel real!

She definitely didn't want to eat any more cupcakes. Just the thought made her head spin and her poor overloaded stomach squeal in dismay. I guess it works, she thought, but gosh, does it have to work quite so well? Surely it would have been enough just to dull her cravings without stuffing her to the point of exploding!

"En-enough," she moaned. Maybe this spell just wasn't made for a pixie's stomach -- she didn't see how she could accomplish anything like this. She could barely even move. Closing her eyes, she concentrated on manipulating the mystical variables which danced in front of her eyes. Reverse that, and move that here...

At once she felt relief as her burstingly bloated stomach shriveled back down to normal. Phew! She ran her hands over her flat abdomen, and hitched up her skirt, which had begun to sag. The waistband had been stretched out by what would have been two or three inches on a human. It would have to be tightened.

After that, it almost felt good to be hungry, at least at first. But soon, she was right back where she started, daydreaming of chocolate frosting and salivating with delight and anticipation.

No!, she chided herself. Stop it! Remember how it felt to make a pig of yourself?

Ah, but you don't have to eat that much, cooed Miffie's shoulder devil (which was practically microscopic, but very persuasive). Just a few. Just take the edge off!

A few cupcakes did sound so wonderful... but if she made a pig of herself, her mother would know, and she'd be disappointed. Again. And Miffie would probably never get to learn another spell, not even if she lived to be a million!

But then again...

What if her mother didn't need to know?

What if Miffie ate her fill and then blamed the inevitable bulge on Phantus Gustes? Not only would she look responsible and continent, but she's get brownie points for practicing. Which I already did it anyway so I definitely deserve them!, she thought defiantly. She couldn't do it all the time, of course. Definitely not. She'd get fat. But just once... just today... just to bury those chocolate cravings alive under a thick layer of moist, crumbly cake!

She created one cupcake, then another, then another, then another -- having your stomach stretched out and emptied like that could really sharpen your appetite!

When Kara returned home--
15111211.title: Pangs, pangs, go away...

choices: At the bakery, Kara sets up a date with the baker.
Kara teaches Miffie another spell the next day.
151112111.content:
Miffie eyes managed to widen despite the large chunk of cupcake already in her mouth, swallowing it down swiftly at the sight of her mother. She knew she didn't look at her best. Crumbs were strewn about her, half-devoured cupcakes lay dotted around her like a summoning circle, her stomach was bulging and had created quite the tear down the front of her robes.

Opening her mouth once she was sure no food would come streaming out, Miffie flashed her mother her best smile.

"Welcome home mother! I hope you've had a pleasant day!"

Kara shook her head and laughed a little at her daughter's lack of control. Moving close, she charmed a broom to come alive and clean up the mess while picking up Miffie in her palm and cradling her gently, singing an ancient song in a language Miffie didn't know. Still, the tune brought back the pixie's earliest and fondest memory: Kara finding her and claiming her as her own, cradling her infant body to her and humming that song, her dark eyes gleaming as she looked at her.

Soon enough, Miffie was drowsy and in her bed, Kara smiling down at her.

"Am I in trouble?"

"No, Miffie, you're not. I know how you get around food but I also know that one day you will be able to overcome it, though you might be a tiny butterball before that happens."

Miffie blushed at that and Kara giggled, setting down a summoned cup of sweet tea. "Take that for your stomach sweetie and tomorrow we'll go to the baker for some food. Does that sound good?"

Miffie nodded and soon fell asleep, dreaming of a land of cupcakes engulfed with her mother's song.
151112111.title: Bus-ted!

choices: Used the next level of Phantus Gustes on her...
Told her to eat everything she was cooking for dinner.
151112112.content:
Kara stared around the kitchen, searching for a sign of stray crumbs or a bit of frosting. However, even her basilisk-holding gaze couldn't catch a single object or bit of food out of place. What she did find, groaning on the counter, was her daughter, stomach full from what could only be the Phantus Gustes. Miffie even burped then, quite loud for her tiny pixie body, Kara chuckling a bit at the sound.

Moving closer, she picked up her magically full child and lifted her up to her face.

"I see you've mastered the spell now."

"Yup," Miffie replied, hand going to her mouth to hold back another belch.

"Well, best undo it so I can get dinner ready."

She placed Miffie back on the counter and waited. Miffie reached out a tiny finger, which was trembling a bit, and said the spell.

Kara raised one of her eyebrows once she noticed Miffie's midriff was not gong back to normal. Moving her face lower, she sniffed around her daughter's mouth and caught the tell-tale scent of magically-created food.

"Heh, did I tell you that you don't look a day over three hundred mother?" Miffie said, batting her eyes in the way she knew her mother adored.

Still, Kara didn't break, merely pointed a finger at Miffie and...
151112112.title: Stuffed Full of "Magic"

choices: It's the first day of the Young Apprentices' magic tournament.
A Pixiologist is going to be interviewing Miffie for a tome about pixies.
1511121122.content:
"Well, I'm glad your stomach is empty now, Miffie, because I'm making your favorite tonight; glitter mushrooms over spice bread!" Kara said, smiling.

She expected Miffie to break down right then and there. The poor girl had obviously stuffed herself with cupcakes and tried to cover it up with a transparent lie. Out of the corner of her eye, she saw a sea of conflicting emotions wash over her face. Relief -- I fooled her! Guilt -- I'm lying to mother... And a healthy dose of queasy apprehension -- I'm going to have to eat more?

She didn't show any signs of coming clean, though. Kara sighed inwardly. Well, I'll give her the chance to admit it herself, she decided. Surely once a heavy plate of the sparkling, multicolored mushrooms were fried up and set before her, she would break down and confess her deception rather than glut herself further.

Miffie herself was biting her lip in desperation. Perched on her special chair, she massaged her belly, trying to make a little room during this brief window while the food was cooking. I'll just have to find the room, she told herself sternly. I can't let mother down again!

Far sooner than she wished, a heaping saucer of steaming mushrooms was set before her.

"Isn't this a -- a lot, mother?" she said nervously. "I don't w-want to get fat!"

"You're a growing girl, and you need to eat something," Kara explained. "You may have felt full all day, but in reality, you haven't eaten a thing." She looked at Miffie expectantly. "Right?"

Come on Miffie, come clean!

But Miffie just averted her eyes and picked up her fork.

-------

I'll give her this, Kara said to herself, laying her groaning daughter on the bed, she's a determined little thing. She had been sure that Miffie would give up; if not during the first plate, then surely she should have snapped when Kara ladled a second helping in front of her! And yet the poor girl had maintained the deception, eating and eating until every speck was gone and her stomach was so distended that Kara was afraid to offer her thirds, fearing the girl might actually burst before admitting her wrongdoing.

Kara smiled sadly and pulled the covers up over the sleeping girl. Miffie moaned, gurgled, and turned to her side. Poor thing was so scared she would disappoint me again, she thought. Well, gorging herself into such an uncomfortably overstuffed state was punishment enough. Kara wouldn't mention it again, and hopefully Miffie would learn her lesson.

----

The next morning, Miffie awoke, stretched, and let out a couple of cute little burps. She still felt rather stuffed, and had no desire to eat breakfast, but at least she wasn't so full she could scarcely breathe. She never wanted to eat that much again!

Especially, she sighed, looking herself over in the pearl-handled hand mirror which served her as a full-length dressing mirror, because it's making me puffy! She prodded herself, feeling soft and squishy all over. She hoped it was just her imagination -- who wouldn't feel fat, after last night? -- but the tightness of her favorite tiger-lily skirt told her otherwise. She sighed. What a time to have a "fat day" -- on today, of all dates!
1511121122.title: Big Fat Liar

choices: An enchanted ring that amplifies magical abilities! Well... crown, for Miffie.
The ancient arcane tome of Mage Engorda Bacchus, a rare read indeed!
15111211221.content:
"On today of all days..." she repeated quietly to herself

She idly ran her fingers up the taut drum that was her middle, cupping it as her stomach beneath let out a pained gurgle and wincing as the sound reached her ears. She had really overdone it last night, hadn't she? Mischief was natural, very much like a second nature to Pixie-kind, but lying was far from natural. In fact, Miffie had never really lied to her mother before, especially over something as silly as having snacked before suppertime. Perhaps she could come clean and that would ease the throbbing pain in her belly...

Her eyes traveled back to the handmirror, focusing peculiarly on her somewhat still-distended middle. After having eaten so much last night, and being as small as she was, it was only natural that everything would be a little bloated. Mother hadn't exactly proportioned supper to "Miffie-sized". Thankfully, she was still full. Not Phantus Gustus full, but full all the same.

"Miffie!" her mother's voice came from the kitchen

Upon her parental beckoning, the tiny girl instinctively fluttered upwards from the nightstand, stealing one last glance at herself to make sure her long blue locks were parted correctly. Finding it hard to smile at herself, still plagued by the queasiness towards her betrayal (or, maybe that was just indigestion) Miffie let out a puff of air and shrugged.

"Coming, Mother!" she cried out in an attempt to seem her usual self.

The pixie, clad in tiger lily, flapped quietly into the room. Where her entrances were usually a spectacle (often getting so excited at another day of mentoring magic that she would fly straight into the furniture) this morning Miffie was quiet and seemed sullen. Feeling heavy with sadness and overindulgence, Kara's tiny ward sat down on the dinner table with her legs crossed.

"You called?" she asked in a poor imitation of her usual chipper tone, not wanting to hint that she was plagued by inner feelings of treason to her poor doting mother. Kara turned from the counter to face her daughter, her gentle matronly smile bound between what were either dimples or "sophistication lines" (as she preferred to call them). As always she knelt down and gave her daughter a big kiss, well everything was big to Miffie, on the forehead.

"Good morning, my little Sugarplum." she said sweetly, "Are you excited for today?"

Said sugarplum smiled awkwardly at the question, "Um... of course I am!" her pitch deceptively so with a wiggle of her antennae, "The Magic Tournament begins today and I get to go watch. I thought that's what last night was for... aren't you judging again this year?"

Kara smiled knowingly, a glimmer of excitement in her wise gray eyes. "Actually Miffie, I won't be judging this year."

Miffie was more than a little confused now. Her mother wasn't going to be judging this year, which was fine of course, but she always seemed so excited about doing it. Something about "seeing the next generation of mages, witches, and wizards at their start" or whatever it was her mother said at the opening every year. Why did she seem so happy? Was this a punishment- was she not going to get to go?

"Y-You're not?" Miffie tiptoed, raising to her feet, "So... then what was--"

"--That was your celebratory meal, Miffie!" her mother said wryly, "After all, how are you supposed to participate in the Young Apprentice's Magic Tournament on an empty stomach?" In all actuality, of course, that was only half true. That was the intention of the meal last night, but Kara admitted inwardly that it was mostly about Miffie's lying. But whatever, a moment's a moment. She had long forgiven her daughter.

"Wh-What?" Miffie asked, her wings shimmering with a faint blue glow as her antennae perked up, "P-Participate?" she parroted stupidly, as if her mother was speaking Ogrish

"That's right." Kara smiled warmly, "And the prize is--
15111211221.title: Well she IS a Young Apprentice...

choices: -- an obstacle course.
-- a dueling arena.
151112112211.content:
"-- a ring that will increase your magic power by up to two hundred millithaums!"

"Oh, wow!" Miffie said, her eyes shining. "But... wait... I guess it won't fit me, will it?"

"Nonsense," Kara said dismissively. "You can wear it as a belt--"

She eyed her daughter's middle.

"-- as a crown," she amended hastily.

"Goody!" Miffie said. "You watch, mother. I'll make you proud!"

"I'll be proud as long as you do your best."

"I know. But I'm going to win, too!"

-----------

The wriggling, uncertain feeling in Miffie's stomach had nothing to do with being full. She looked out over the village green, which had been cleared for the occasion. There were so many spectators... the bleachers were full of them! Surely there hadn't been so many last year. And surely last year the only young mages hadn't been quite so... fierce looking.

They look like a bunch of killers, Miffie thought nervously. There was a serious-looking girl dressed all in black, her face criss-crossed with tattooed runes. A young half-elven man in the dandified clothes of a noble polished an expensive-looking mahogany wand, surrounded by stoic retainers. A crafty-looking goblin girl fingered one of the potion flasks in the bandolier around her chest.

"C-can she even bring those?" Miffie asked, pointing out the goblin. "That can't be allowed!"

"As long as she brewed them herself, it's fair."

"Ohh. I should have done something like that!"

There are still stains on the kitchen floor from the last time you tried to brew a potion, Kara thought wryly, but said nothing. She patted Miffie on the head.

"Just have fun, okay? And don't be scared to hit them with everything you've got!" She pointed out the elaborately scribed black line surrounding the field. "This area is death warded, so nobody can die or be seriously injured during the competition. Don't hold back!"

Miffie flexed one tiny muscle uncertainly. The truth was, after seeing her competition, she almost wanted to turn around and fly home.

"All competitors, to the starting area!" boomed a magically amplified voice. Hesitantly, she followed the others into a low bunker at the edge of the field. She turned to see her mother waving and blowing her a kiss, and then the heavy iron door slid down in her face.

"Well, look what we got here," the goblin girl smirked as soon as the sound of the crowd cut off. "A little flyin' baby. A fat little flyin' baby, at that."

Some of the assembled mages snickered. The half-elf dandy yawned. "My, they're letting just about everyone in this year, aren't they? Present company definitely included."

"Shut it, fancypants," the goblin growled. "Unless you want a snootful of Elixir of Itch!"

"From those pedestrian flasks? Ugh! I only use Wellington-Breethby fine crystal drinking vials!"

The girl in black just stared at Miffie, seeming to bore holes into her with her deep black eyes. The pixie felt a chill wriggling up her spine like an icy earthworm.

Just then, the door slid open again. The field preparations were complete. The village green had been transformed into--
151112112211.title: Ready... get set...

choices: Miffie and the goblin.
The half-elf and Methos's apprentice.
1511121122112.content:
There was no more green in the village green, grey now the only color one could see, a flat, circular, slab of stone. Simplicity was apparently the motto for this year's competition. The judges, all of them hooded, were hovering all around the edge of the arena.

Below them, crowding round, were the spectators, chairs provided by the local mage's guild, Kara seated in the chair closest to the arena, her eyes taking in every last bit of the ground where her daughter would be displaying her abilities to the representatives of the known magical world. Her heart went out to the pixie bravely staring down some of the other apprentices, her gaze locked on her daughter, when a hand suddenly found her shoulder.

"I see you still cling to that tiny mote-of-nothing, legendary hero."

Kara glared at the hand and it removed itself, shaking just a little. "Methos, what brings you all the way out here?"

"My apprentice," Methos said, her voice sibilant and husky. Kara followed her fellow mage's eyes and saw the hooded girl impassively staring at her daughter. "She's well-versed in illusive magic, conjuration, and transfiguration. Next to her, your pathetic pixie is a bug, easily squashed."

"Nothing is set in stone. I taught you that, remember?"

Methos's red eyes bored into her then and she huffed. "You only taught me weakness. When I discovered there was real power to be had, I ceased to be your student."

Kara merely shook her head and returned her full attention to her daughter.

One of the judges addressed the apprentices and audience.

"The rules are simple: the first combatant to lose consciousness is out of the tournament. Any combatant caught using high-level spells will be disqualified. Any attempt at receiving aid from any of your teachers on the outside will also result in an ejection from this contest. May the strongest magic shine brightest!"

With that, the arena's aura expanded slightly, all but two of the apprentices now benched there, observes to the first match between...

choices: Next up, Miffie gets a rocky start but ultimately shows off her Pixie Power!
Miffie gets a little more bench-time, where she quietly observes her opponent...
15111211221122.content:
The sky above was a pristine cloudless blue expanse which loomed overhead heavily, as if it too was engrossed in the two competitors that stood below and was on the edge of its seat.

On the right hand, the Elven dandy from before stood at attention, facing his first opponent sternly and without break in concentration. His stance was strong, ready to swish-and-flick his wand at a moment's notice. While he was considerably taller than most Elves, he was certainly just as lean and wiry as any other member of his kin. Once he had stripped most of the fine linen outfit he had appeared in and embroidered leather overcoat, everyone could see that he was just toned enough for intimidation, though slender enough to show that physical attempts at violence were clearly not his forte.

The light bounced off of his pale yellow skin, the outline of his proud elvish nose clearly visible in his shadow on the stone floor below him, as he clearly eyed the mysterious girl he was to face in hopes of catching some weak spots in her perfectly erect stance. When he couldn't find any, no doubt he comforted himself with how much richer than her his family was.

Certainly she looked to have come into some money at some point, at least enough to fund her personal sense of fashion. Her pale gray skin was tattooed with, by the looks of it, a blood red ink that made up intricate runes. She was covered in a long black cloak, drawn to cover her shoulders and plexus, but left the remainder of her torso and legs exposed. That being said, however, she looked to be dressed in thick black pants that would certainly have been murder if the day hadn't been so cool.

Like the strange woman in the crowd, the mysterious girl's eyes seemed to flash a dark red underneath her hood. And not unlike her opponent, the heated stare of those red eyes seemed fixed on an opponent. Though not the dapper young gentleman across from her, no... Miffie could have sworn that those creepy peepers were looking directly at her in the sidelines!

Between the two of them, a stone statue vaguely resembling a human in shape, held up a flag proudly. Though the crowd was antsy and the tension cuttable with even the dullest of cutlery, that which was to act as referee and starting signal for the tournament would not move. His arm raised high in the air, red flag flapping gently in the slight breeze, he waited uncaringly for the official signal to begin.

High above the actual arena, in a stone viewing gallery that rested over the stadium's pews, three arcane masters sat and kept the audience waiting on their sign of approval that the games could begin. Two of them men, one ridiculously bearded human and an ogre with a slight pituitary, and one of them a woman, an elvish monarch called last-second for a token female judge upon Kara's announcement that she would only be spectating this year. They whispered amongst themselves for a moment as they watched the atmosphere below thicken and swirl with anxiety. This would set the bar for all other duels that were to commence today... though, by the looks of the contestants already present, things were sure to get interesting.

"Runes? Do we still allow those?" the man turned to face his fellow viewers

"Only if they're tribal." the Ogre grunted as he gnashed on a turkey's leg, "We used to ban 'em back in the Goldveil Shaman and Magecraft games. Think we should say somethin'?"

"No, no, allow the girl to play the game." came the sweet sophisticated input of the elf, "I think they're... pretty." she settled to herself

There was a slight pause between the two men as they turned to face each other. "Women. Pheh." the Mage rolled his eyes, "These young scholars are here to blow each other up, not accessorize."

"I suppose if she applied them herself then it's allowed." Came the turkey-speckled splatter of the Ogre's input as his greasy green mitts pawed at the official rulebook for the tournament, "We let in potions and enchanted weapons all the time..."

The grown man huffed, "Fine, but I don't like it." he pouted like a child eight hundred years his junior. He snapped, and a blue flame sparked over the arena.

The statue's arm fell suddenly and the competitors came to life! The Dapper Dandy on the right armed with his wand, aglow a silvery hue with his magical energies, as the Mysterious Mage on the left's hands began to glow a murderous red, energy wrapping around her fingers and settling into the shape of bladed knuckles. Conjuration spells were her specialty indeed!

Miffie could only blink as that uneasy feeling in her stomach came back once more. She watched as the Elf gallantly (or, as gallantly as a snooty jerk like him could get) faced against his opponent. For some reason... maybe it was the murderous death glares... she couldn't help but not like that girl. Even as she weaved and dodged the boy's firebolts and even managed to cut every piece of enchanted arrow that was thrown her way, she never missed a single beat. Her movements were fluid, absolute liquid as she danced her way closer to the dreadful snob.

He paused after looking into her eyes, taking a second too long to analyze the situation.

Her conjured knife was in his back before he knew what hit him... and then he did, once the Death-Ward took place. But still, he had lost. If this had happened outside the arena walls, he would have been dead... and she had only used one spell!

So why was Little-Miss-Sunshine busy staring daggers at Miffie, and not her should-be-dead opponent?

Miffie was suddenly in the arena, staring at her foe, the female goblin with the penchant for potions. The goblin's bone armor were obviously taken from several kobolds and the yellow-white color of the bones clashed with the goblin's lime-green skin.

"Gonna melt your little wings off, bug!" the goblin crowed, a potion flying Miffie's way.

Dodging, Miffie prepared an energy blast only to be caught of guard as a column of smoke blinded her, the wisps of smoke soon becoming a large cobra, with bared fangs. Flying upwards, she unleashed the blast she had intended for her foe and dissipated the conjured apparition.

Miffie was about to fly higher when she felt those red eyes from the hooded young woman on her, the recognition of that piercing glare freezing her for a split second. A moment that sent Miffie tumbling to the ground, bound to the grey slate of an arena by a yellowish goo.

Her wings were helpless against the strength of the goo and what's worse, she could feel the stuff pressing against her body slowly, sure to crush her if she allowed things to remain as they were.

Hands coated in the stuff, as well as most of her body save for her face and bits of her wings, Miffie concentrated on her magical energy, rerouting it from her hands to her eyes, beams of eldritch light shooting out and searing through her bonds.

Now free, the crowd eerily silent, Miffie smirked as she tapped her cheering foe on the shoulder, the goblin whirling around and gaping at her suddenly freed enemy.

But before the goblin could strike, Miffie used her newest spell, the goblin on her back and belching mightily, groaning as her middle bulged outwards.

Tapping her fingers on the stone in the symbol of surrender, the crowd cheered as Miffie was announced the victor.

Looking out to her mother, Miffie beamed as Kara smiled the largest smile Miffie could recall seeing on her face.

"Will our final contestants please take their positions?"

Kara watched as Miffie lethargically rose from her spot, slowly hovering over to her end of the field. She glanced over at her tiny daughters opponent - the apprentice of her former student. Kara couldn't help but grimace at the sight of the black-cloaked girl standing stock-still across from her pixie protege.
