+++

Miffie felt a cold dread wash over her as she hovered uncertainly over the starting position. She suddenly thought it ridiculous that she had ever been excited in any way about entering this dumb tournament. She wasn't ready for this! She couldn't even remember the basic elemental attacks!

A quick glance at her opponent provided Miffie with nothing but a eyeful of that hate-filled glare that seemed to have been on her the whole tournament. Miffie shivered, and adjusted her skirt. She could feel the remnants of last nights massive meal burbling around in her bloated little tummy, and she was beginning to feel a bit nauseous - mostly nerves, but her still full belly probably didn't help the matter. Wow, I really overdid it last night...

Miffie was suddenly snapped out of her thoughts by an enthusiastic roar from the crowd of spectators. She looked around, confused for a moment, before catching sight of the stone statue with it's flag lowered. The match had started!

Caught totally unawares and distinctly lacking in the 'plan' department, Miffie gazed helplessly as her amber-eyed foe began chanting some incantations under her breath. The little pixie, having no idea what to expect, began desperately muttering the appropriate verses to a shielding charm - well, the verses she could remember, anyways. Her nervous nausea was suddenly replaced by unbridled fear as the protective bubble she was supposed to be encasing herself in failed to materialize. Across the field, her rival continued chanting as a purple orb of energy began to form around her.

Miffie was filled with horror as she finished her half-improvised charm - which had done nothing but tinge the air around her a sickly yellow color - and continued to watch the incredibly long spell that was taking place across from her. Miffie became terribly aware of the crowd's ooh-ing and ahh-ing at the sight of the glowing purple orb that had now surrounded her foe, and she could have sworn she hear Kara shouting something terribly impolite. Though she was sure it wasn't really her mother, (Kara never would say those naughty words!) the crushing thought that she was going to let her mother down again pressed down on Miffie. As she braced herself from whatever terrible thing was going to come from that sphere, Miffie wondered if Kara would forgive her. She couldn't even preform a simple shield charm correctly! She was a disgrace to all pixie-kind!

Resigned to these thoughts, she closed her eyes and instinctively shielded her face with her tiny arms as a beam of light shot from the ball, flying directly at her -

Miffie felt the air begin to vibrate violently around her as a gasp emanated from the stands. She waited, not wanting to see what was happening to her. Probably something extraordinarily terrible. The air continued to vibrate, making her tiny little ears pop. She continued to hold her position, shutting her eyes even tighter, waiting for some sort of pain.

Then the vibrations stopped. A wild cheer from the crowd nearly drowned out an exhausted, indignant cry from the apprentice across the field.

Gathering all of her courage, Miffie cracked open her eyes and peeped over her arm. She saw the now aura-less figure standing across from her, panting, eyes staring metaphorical daggers into Miffies very soul. Completely removing her arm from over her eyes, Miffie saw with wonder that she was now fully encased in a brownish-yellow bubble, sparks of purple energy still dancing over its surface. Slowly, the impromptu shield faded.

Did I... did I just block that? Miffie thought with amazement. But I just made up half of the charm!

Across the field, the cloaked girl was screaming at her between pants. "That's not possible! That is completely impossible!" her eyes flared crimson, and her tattoos seemed even more menacing.

Miffie, with a sudden surge of confidence, tried her best to steel her face, deciding that what worked before would work again. She closed her eyes, manipulating the correct magical variables, and suddenly -

"Whaah!" the girl screamed in surprise as her stomach filled with Phantus Gustes. Miffie opened her eyes, smiling at the sight of her opponent knocked to the ground by her sudden expansion. She could do this! There was no way to fight when you were in that condition - Miffie would know!

Miffies new-found confidence was instantly swept away, however, when with an incantation and a flick of the wrist, her foe was back to her average size - and looking ready to kill, having been humiliated in such a way.

Miffie felt it even as she saw those red eyes close - a tingling sensation all over her body. Quickly, the tingling grew more intense, becoming painful. Suddenly, Miffies tiny body was wracked with pain - her wings gave out and she tumbled to the ground, feeling like she was being stabbed by a thousand needles. All she wanted to do was black out, to lose consciousness.

Suddenly a sound like an explosion was heard, and the pain stopped.

+++

Kara stormed onto the field, the three members of the judging panel trailing behind her. The bearded old human was shouting at the top of his lungs, "I knew it! I told you! 'Those runes are a bad thing,' I said! But did you listen?"

The female elf was looking worriedly at the tattooed competitor whom Kara had just sent halfway across the stadium. "Oh, dear, is she going to be alright? I feel as though that was a tad bit excessive, that Air Pulse was completely unnecessary..."

The old ogre just waved his chicken thigh. "Ah, she'll be fine. Death ward'll make sure o' it."

Kara just walked on, her face contorted with anger. How dare somebody use those spells? On her daughter! To think that that filthy bitch was teaching her student those things make her shiver in her core.

She soon had her tiny daughter cradled in one hand. Miffie was awake, if not a little woozy.

"D-did I lose, mother? I-I'm so sorry..." she stuttered out. Kara's heart melted. After what had just happened, she was worried about impressing her. Kara felt another surge of hate for the girl she had just blasted halfway to the Northern Woods.

"No, Miffie. You didn't lose. You won." she said it proudly, haughtily. "I knew you could do it all along."

Miffie looked confused. "But - there's no way I won. I didn't do anything. She got me with that - that spell."

Kara smiled grimly. "MIffie, you won because neither of the spells she used were legal. The first was an incredibly advanced magic - resulting in elimination. The second was Phantus Dolor. It is another Mirage of the Mind - the reason they are sometimes called 'dark magic'. While Phantus Gustes tricks you into believing you are full, this one... well, you know what it does."

Miffie nodded sagely. "So I win? I get the ring?"

Kara smiled. "You betcha."

Miffie, beginning to regain her composure, stood up in Kara's palm. She tentatively fluttered off of her mothers hand, testing her wings. Finding them in full working order, she fluttered up to Karas shoulder and perched on it.

Leaning into her ear, she whispered, "So, does this mean I get to choose what's for dinner?

Kara just laughed.

Kara leaned back in her chair, sighing contently. Her daughters own celebratory meal had been delicious, and nearly perfectly done - well, except for the duck, which had been nearly uncooked. But Kara had fixed that up without Miffie noticing.

Kara sighed again, and stifled a little burp. Given the occasion, she had let herself go a tad - but had stopped as soon as she had noticed that her daughter actually seemed to have it in mind to eat more than her. The thought was absolutely ridiculous, given that Miffie stood at most twelve inches tall on her tippy-toes, but that didn’t mean she hadn’t tried.

Scratch that - that didn’t mean she wasn’t still trying. Miffie, caught up in the joy of winning the tournament, had completely forgotten her dietary woes of earlier that morning. She had fallen on her self-made feast like a dwarf on to a finely-aged ale. First, she had to try everything she had created, just to make sure it had come out alright. Then, she needed seconds, to make sure the middles were well-done. Finally, a third round of her favorites needed to be Miffi-sized and packed away - just because she could.

Now, the little pixie seemed oddly immune to the effects of her meal - seated at her own miniature table, she slouched back in her tiny chair, admiring a heavily-frosted (Miffi-sized) cupcake with eyes full of desire. After a moment of admiring her creation she popped the entire thing in her mouth, her cheeks bulging out cutely as she chewed.

Kara smirked as Miffie expertly floated a chocolate chip cookie as big as herself to her table and shrunk it to a devourable size.

Kara looked at Miffies frosting-stained cheeks, her her chocolate-smeared fingers - and most importantly, her heavily bloated tummy. It strained against her leafy green top, poking at least three-quarters of an inch into Miffies tiny lap. To Kara, it looked like yet another terrible belly-ache waiting to happen.

“You know, you’ll probably regret that cookie later.” Kara said as Miffie lifted the goodie to her mouth.

The cookie stopped mid-flight as its captor paused to examine it.

“Yea, probably.” Miffie said, before popping it into her mouth.

Kara chuckled at the pixies undeniably lacking logical skills. She decided now was the time to talk about the tournament, if just to stop Miffie from stuffing herself any farther.

“So Miffie,” she began, as the girl began to eye one of the few surviving cupcakes, “Just what was that shield charm you casted in the last match? I know I sure didn’t teach it to you - in fact, I’ve never seen it before in my life.”

Miffie blushed as she turned her eyes from the snack to her mother. “Uh... well... I kinda made it up.”

Kara looked at her in disbelief. “You made a charm?”

“W-w-well no,” Miffie corrected herself hastily. “I had one in mind, but I sorta forgot some of the words, and I just... made some up.”

Kara shook her head. “Your lucky. You could have seriously injured yourself. Don’t ever do that again.”

“Sorry mother.” Miffie mumbled. She felt bad - her mother had warned her constantly of performing a piece of magic she didn’t know well. She looked for a quick change of the subject.

“So mother... I saw you talking to a lady in the stands. Was that a friend? Why haven't I ever met her?”

Miffie felt her mother tense up, immediately realizing that the change in subject had probably been a bad one.

“Miffie...” Kara said, in that tone only a parent could take, “before I found you, I had... other apprentices.”

Miffie was shocked. “You had other kids...?”

“Yes, I’ve never adopted any but you as my own.” Kara was quick to point out. “These students of magic came to me, seeking my guidance. Now, the woman I was talking to is named Methos. She was my apprentice quite a while ago. She immediately showed great potential to become a powerful mage, and I taught her at a rapid pace.

Kara moved her gaze from her daughter to the window. “But Methos soon was bored by simple spells. She began to read on her own, practice late at night. I didn’t know that she was learning spells far beyond her experience level. She began to think of herself as a prodigy, a one-of-a-kind, and thought I was holding her back. One day, she came down to breakfast, stunned me as I cooked her pancakes, and left. She’s been snooping around here for years now, causing trouble. This was the first time I’ve actually spoke with her since she left me.”

Kara turned back to her daughter, smiling wryly. “She’s a bad nut, Miff. Just try to forget about her.”

Kara didn’t exactly have to worry about that. She had to work hard to keep her ‘serious face’ up as she looked at Miffie, who was slouched so far into her seat she was nearly laying on it.

Apparently, the pixies stomach had finally realized that the abuse had to stop sometime during Karas nostalgic rant, and poor Miffie was just now feeling the full effects of her most recent culinary conquest.

“Oh, uh - *hic* - wha?” Miffie mumbled as she snapped back to reality, adjusting her golden ‘crown’ with one hand, rubbing her overfilled stomach with the other.

Kara gave up the serious face, and broke into a wide grin. “Oh, nothing important. Soo...” her grin grew a tad bit mischievous, “You want another cupcake?”

Miffie moaned. “Ohhhh, mother, I don’t think I’m gonna eat another cupcake in my life.” and after a cute little belch, added, “Or anything else, for that matter...”

“Oh, Miff, you’re such a terrible liar.” Kara chuckled as she gently scooped her suffering daughter into her hand. “C’mon, you need some rest. It’s been a long day.”

“Whoa, mother, take it easy.” Miffie said, clutching her groaning middle as she lay in her mother’s hand.

Soon enough, Miffie was fast asleep, her tired tummy left with the task of finding somewhere to put her massive meal. Kara looked at her sleeping daughter with pride. She looked at her pointer finger, where her own ring she won from her first Young Apprentices Tournament sat - an exact replica of Miffies. Then again, she hadn’t eaten her weight in foodstuffs afterwards...

With a silent chuckle, Kara turned out the lights, and went to clean the dishes.

The life of a mage, at least one as prolific as the enigmatic Kara, was one filled with modest pleasures and simple joys.

When all one has to do is spout an enchantment or write up a spell, after some time a certain yearning for hard labor and the sweat on one's brow is developed. Kara was always one for preaching similar values, and the activities that made up her daily life usually reflected as such. Instead of casting a Dirt Ward over her humble cottage, she would take the time to clean it up herself. Rather than store supplies in an interdimensional pocket outside of time and space, Kara practiced the art of "Spring Cleaning" to rid her home of things no longer required. And instead of conjuring up food from nowhere(as her daughter had become so versed in) Kara preferred going to the market and actually paying for goods and services.

Sweeping, however, was something a little more menial that she felt could be done in the background by someone other than herself.

And for free, since she had all of the necessary tools.

While she was busy preparing the night's supper, chopping up souroot on the cutting table, her ever-faithful and as of now enchanted broom had been instructed to sweep himself around the kitchen, pushing whatever was to be found in the also enchanted dustpan and then thrown out the non-sentient window. Because that would be weird.

Kara's tone was jovial as she lightly hummed the score of a song she had heard recently in town, a traveling bard had regaled the other taverners with a musical tale about a faraway king slaying an evil dragon (or something, he wasn't a very good bard.) An earnest smile across her face as she enjoyed the fruits of her labor. Her faith was bolstered, as she had been told in the youth of her studies, she was sure that her sweat and toil would show in the quality of the stew.

Finished with the last stalk, Kara scooped up the dark green pieces of root and plopped them collectively into the nearby pot. She would then move onto the dwarvesbane and swampbuddle, chopping the bane and peeling the bud, before fetching some water. If Miffie would arrive home with the hogmeat, they could enjoy supper within three hours.

*KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK*

"Malachi, be a dear and go get that, would you?" Kara instructed her broom, her response a mute conferrence from the wooden bristly servant before it swept its way over to the door.

It wedged the tip of its shaft into the handle of the door and pulled backwards, allowing the heavy oaken port to open slowly. It was a broom, and therefore not very well versed in anything that didn't involving brooming.

Kara lifted her gaze from the table, her pace with the knife slowing as she did so, to see quite the familiar sight:

"Archie?" she asked aloud to the aged man standing in her doorway, "Is that really you?"

"Aye, 'tis." the decrepit gentleman said with a smile behind graying whiskers, "Mind if an ol' student stopped by?

"Of course, of course!" Kara said warmly, dropping her knife on the table as she ushered in her former student

Archemedes Helgason, or as all those whom had deemed his name too "formal" or "strict" had come to know him as "Archie", was a short drink of water. He was a human, with dwarven blood somewhere by the looks of him, with a curly mop of brown hair that was beginning to fade in his old age. He had come to Kara some thirty years ago in pursuit of a love potion, having heard of her prolific powers in potionry. She accepted, with the usual hoo-ha about responsibility and whatnot which Archie promptly ignored, and was not surprised when the little fellow was back a week later asking how to reverse the effects.

Since then Archie had been a welcome guest in Kara's humble home. He lived a bit of a walk's way away, in Davenport, so his visits were scarce. But over the years Kara had watched him grow into a wonderful man. She was present at his wedding, to a stout woman with large knockers, and was always eager to help him through any problem she could (frequent loans and magical "favors" being the most common, though she didn't mind the former as much as the latter). He had grown even shorter and quite round in his elder years, though she could still place his boistrous laugh and rosy red cheeks even behind his shaggy beard.

The would-be dwarf lumbered over to the dining room table and groaned as he sat down, patting his beer belly. "Got any ale, then?" he asked with a smile, "If ya don't mind that is?"

"Of course not." Kara answered kindly as she levitated the bottle from its setting (far from Miffie's reach). Normally she would have gotten it herself, but she could tell by the amazed twinkle in Archie's eyes that he was still very amazed by even the simplest of tricks

"Ya really oughtta teach me that one 'a these days." he said

"I've been trying to teach you how to pull a gold piece from behind your ear for the past three decades," Kara joked as she pulled up a seat across from her former student, "I think that levitation might have to wait."

Archie laughed, his belly shaking like gelatine, "You really are a quick one, you are."

Kara smiled, it was always nice to hear that every now and then. In return, she wriggled her finger and instructed the bottle to pour directly into a conjured cup. Archie was giddy with excitement, clapping his callused hands together like a child.

"Lookee that!" he shouted in utter amazement "Oh Teach, you are somethin'."

Kara smiled, "Well when you've been doing this for as long as I have, it gets a little old."

Archie grabbed the glass with his large hands and lifted it high above his nose. The ale trickled down into his whiskers and onto his shirt. When the glass hit the table with a loud rattling sound, it was empty.

"So, Archie, how are you?" Kara asked in a manner remincient of a mother who's child never calls, "I only see you... what, couple of years or so?"

"Ah, 'm fine." he said with a wave of his hand, "The wife's gettin' old on me, gettin' fat too. But Gods so am I." he said with a laugh, "Ulter's goin' to work as a smith, a boy after me own heart. Flannery's gettin' married an'... well damn, I've got ten of 'em! Ya can't expect me ta keep track of all of 'em!" he topped off his rant with another boistrous laugh that shook the whole house

"Well I'm happy to hear it." Kara said kindly, "Its nice to know that one of my worst students has done so well with his life. Congratulations on having such a big family, Archie." Kara said with a delicate sip of her own glass (substantially smaller that her guest's)

At this, Archie's face grew dour from behind his mud brown beard. "Well, not all is well at the Helgason home. Y'see, me youngest son Laughen... we found him dead in the prarie."

"Oh my goodness, I'm so sorry..."

"Yeah... it looked downright unnatural the way he died. His insides were all over the place. His belly had burst. Strangest thing, poor kid hadn't eaten for hours."

Kara's eyes widened slightly at the description of Laughen. She remembered seeing the boy early in his years, he couldn't have been more than twelve by the time of death. Of course, her sentiments were genuine.

"Oh no Teach, t'ain't your fault." he said with a sad smile, "But I was wonderin'... wonderin' if you'd come back to Davenport with me? Help figger out what's goin' on?"

"Going on, whatever do you mean?"

"Y'see, my boy ain't the first one'ta be found like that. All blown up. Lotsa people about town are startin'ta worry. Not go outside anymore, whisperin' about'a curse or somethin', I dunno. I know better, I know its magic- but it t'aint no curse."

"So... what do you want me to do about it?" Kara asked, "I'll admit, it doesn't sound much like a curse to me, but it does sound like something... forbidden. Even as far as I'm concerned. It sounds like something from the Phantus order of spells, my Miffie was recently exposed to something very much like what you're describing."

"I'm sorry ta hear that... I know how much you loved the little bug."

"My Miffie was lucky, she had been Death-Warded- it was in a competition not but two weeks ago. Still, I'll do whatever I can to help you. When do we leave?"

"I was thinking as soon as possible. Get a good night's sleep, a hot meal, and head out. If we leave tomorrow morning, we should get there by sundown by wagon."

"Sounds good..." Kara said sternly, "I'll just put a hold on this stew for later, the ingredients should still be good if I chill them--

"Now hold on!" Archie said, his former self returning to him as a smile creased his lips, "Just 'cos we're gettin' all serious doesn't mean I'm gonna pass up som'ma yer Hogsmeat Stew! When do we eat?!"

Kara smiled, "As soon as Miffie gets back with the meat."

Kara considered the dangers of letting her precious daughter come along with them on this journey. It was true that Miffie had never been on a quest of this caliber before, or any caliber for that matter. The young pixie’s life of homestuck studying would have to come to an end at some point or another; why not let her first experience out in the world be a safe one with her mother and mentor by her side? However the description of Laughen’s body echoed from the back of her mind, all burst and bloodied in the field, reaffirming her stance on Miffie’s attendance.

After what happened at the tournament…. Seeing Miffie like that again would be too much, considering that the next time she wouldn’t be getting back up.

“Be that as it may, Miffie, I don’t think you’re quite ready enough to come along.” Kara said sternly as she placed her little girl down on the table delicately, “I promise when you’re ready I’ll show you everything you need to know, but not this time. Not yet.”

Miffie’s pretty jaw dropped as she struggled to find the words to speak, “B-B-But the ring, I—“

“Miffie, that’s enough.” Kara cut her off with a raised pointer finger, “You’re a good girl, and I know you just want to help, but I don’t want to see your insides strewn about like that ever again…”

“My insides…?” Miffie repeated to herself, “Mother, if this is about what happened at the tournament, I—“

“Enough, Miffie, I’ve told you too much.” Kara seemed to be getting agitated now, her pretty brow furrowed slightly and the many hairs on Archie’s arms standing on end, “Go to your room, I’ll call you when supper’s ready.”

Miffie opened her mouth one more time, perhaps hoping to say something that might have changed her mother’s mind, but decided against it after getting a stern glaring from both adults in the room. Instead she simply struggled to flutter upwards and down the hall, towards her room.

“Fine…” she grumbled as she sulked away, defeated.

With a tiny mumble, Miffie’s door opened magically (she was far too small to push it open herself) and shut just the same with a loud slam. The two remaining in the dining room were silent for a moment, completely understanding the perils of parenthood without uttering a word to each other.

“I’m very sorry about that.” Kara turned back to Archie as she refilled his glass, “She’s a good girl, and she really does have everyone’s best interests at heart—“

“Ah, you don’t hafta tell me twice.” Archie said sympathetically, “Miff’s a sweetheart after yer own, Teach. I jus’ wish I could handle me own girls as well as you do.”

“Yes well, sometimes I wonder if I’m not coddling her too much.” Kara said, sounding rather defeated herself, “I should really do something nice for her once we get back.”

“T’aint nothin’ to it.” Archie said dismissively, “If your Miffie’s anything like my youngins, she’ll have forgotten about this whole thing by suppertime.”

***


Miffie’s room was far too big for her.

It had actually belonged to the other apprentices that Kara had taken in before her; meaning that the mysterious woman from the tournament, Methos, as well as Archie had slept in her same room at some point in time. Since the bed set out for them was like an entire pasture for puny pixie, Kara had the foresight to set up a Miffie-sized mock bedroom on top of the dresser to make her feel more at home.

That being said, she sat there with her knees brought up to her elbows and sulked, tiny tears rolling down her cheeks. Miffie was never a fan of getting yelled at, especially in front of company, but she didn’t quite understand why it was that her mother was so afraid of her going on this trip! She had proven herself very capable; her ring, currently crowning doll’s head that rested on her tiny desk to act as a mannequin, was surely a testament to that!

She sat there for a while before hearing the familiar ‘click-clack’ of her mother’s shoes. She pushed the door open with one hand, for the other was carrying a small bowl (big enough to sate Miffie’s ever-expanding appetite) between her forefinger and thumb as well as a small pitcher filled with water and a thimble for a cup.

“Miffie, darling?” she said quietly, “I’ve brought you supper.”

Miffie took a minute before answering, “No thank you.”

“Oh honestly honey, you have to eat.” She delicately placed the components of Miffie’s supper on the dresser, “Now I realize you’re upset with me, but understand that you cannot go with me tomorrow. If not for your own safety, then for the sake of me not worrying myself gray-haired and into lunacy.” She pleaded

“I’m not hungry.” Miffie said with a bit of a pout

“Would that have anything to do with the ring of blue frosting around your mouth?”

“M-M-Mother!!” Miffie’s face exploded in bright red, quickly licking and wiping the space around her lips, “H-How did you—“

“I didn’t.” Kara said slyly, “You don’t have anything on your face at all, my dear.”

“Th-That wasn’t funny, I—“ Miffie started as she rose to face her mother, only to slump her shoulders, “I just want to help! I want to help you and Mr. Archie, and I want to help all of his kids! I want to get out of this house, just for a little while!”

“Miffie, no.” Kara said strictly before bending down to kiss her daughter on the forehead, “I am going tomorrow and you will stay here until I get back and that’s that. Mr. Archie is outside loading up the wagon for the trip, I’m leaving you with enough food to last the week. You’ll be fine by yourself.” She said, completely dismissing the conflict between them, “Do your chores, study while I’m gone, and make sure—“

“Make sure that the neighbor girls get their quart of milk. Got it.” Miffie said with a sad smile, “I’ll be good.”

“Oh sweetie…” Kara said with another kiss on what was supposed to be Miffie’s forehead but wound up encompassing the entirety of her blue locks, “You’re always good.”

“I love you, Mother.”

“I love you too, sweetheart.”

As Kara started towards the doorway, she turned back around, “Oh, and Mr. Archie’s going to be sleeping in that bed tonight so… good luck with that.” She added with a mischievous giggle fit for a girl far younger than her advanced age

“MOTHER!!”

***


Midnight, just outside Kara’s cottage. The wagon was boarded and the horses secured within a temporary stable conjured up just for the occasion of unexpected equine guests, at the great courtesy of Kara. In the darkness, a tiny shape is seen fluttering around impatiently, darting back and forth as if looking for…

“Gotta find a way, gotta find a way…” Miffie whispered to herself as she took several aerial paces to and from the wagon. The floorboards were solid, and to rip one up would be to jeopardize the structure of the whole thing. Her mother would surely see through any invisibility spell (if she knew any). She couldn’t hide in the horses’ manes because… well, horses were scary.

When she noticed the shape of two sacks in the rear seat of the cart, certainly large enough for her to squeeze into! Miffie fluttered over and illuminated the area slightly with her aura, a light blue glow allowing her to see and untie the knot that fastened one of the sacks closed. When she had secured her soft shape in the confines of the burlap, she giggled mischievously and retied the knot magically from the inside.

Surely, Mother would understand a young mage’s need for adventure every now and then? Even if it was against her wishes?

Oh she would have the best time playing stowaway in the...

1511121122112211122121.content:
Miffie settled her rump down on a comfortably juicy ham, cured and tied up with a string. She looked around her at all the supplies the sack had to offer. It was all food suited to travelling: salted meats, dried fruit, long-lasting vegetables, and dense lumps of hard bread that would last forever. Still, it was well-made, and looked very tasty.

Her stomach growled, reminding her that her dinner that night hadn't been particularly large. Now she was hungry. What if it happened again and someone heard? Obviously, she had to take care of it, and quick!

She conjured a cupcake and quickly gobbled it down. Now be quiet, stomach! Ah, and here we go, she thought as she felt the wagon begin to move. Finally I'm gonna get to see the world! Adventure! N' excitement! The open road awaits!

------

Miffie was bored out of her little pixie skull.

Uggggggh. What's the point of being on the open road if you're stuck in a stupid sack?

She wanted to poke her head out and see what was going on. But she didn't dare--her mother was out there! She could get caught! So she squatted in her sack, bored. And when Miffie got bored, she couldn't really help but eat.

The first hour or so was dedicated to cupcakes. After that, she gave herself a stern warning. For sure I can't just eat cupcakes the whole time! By the time we got there, I'd be too fat to fly! But on the other hand, she was just so bored. She had to eat something.

If I stuff myself with the rest of the supplies, she decided rationally, I won't be tempted to eat more cupcakes.

So she downed a number of dried apricots and a few dozen nuts and started in on some of the heavy trail bread. She was starting to fill up nicely, but figured--it was only reasonable after all--that she'd better really stuff herself. Otherwise she might feel the urge to eat another cupcake. And then she would get fat.

This is for the sake of my figure! she admonished herself as she forced down the last of the bread. Her stomach was quite packed now, and she wriggled a bit, trying to find a comfortable position on the ham. She smacked her lips. They were dry--really dry, after all that bread with nothing to drink. She slid off the ham, moving a couple of empty bags inside to hit on the waterskin just below her. It sloshed like a waterbed under her feet. She uncorked the top and guzzled greedily. The water was magically cooled and flavored with lemon and berry. It was deliciously refreshing.

Miffie drank until she'd had her fill, then tried to replace the stopper. But it wouldn't fit. She tried to force it and only succeeded it having it fly out of her hands. Now the waterskin was tipping, sliding over. The water was beginning to pour out and nothing Miffie could think of would stop it! If her mother saw that something was leaking in the bag, she would investigate for sure!

There was only one thing for Miffie to do. She put her lips to the slipping skin and drank desperately, chugging down the water as quickly as it could leak out. Maybe...just maybe... she could drain the skin, though she despaired to thing how bloated her poor belly would be by the end of it all.
1511121122112211122121.title: Travelling is Thirsty Work

choices: Miffie manages to stay hidden—when the cart reaches Davenport that afternoon...
Miffie does something to blow her cover—Wow Mother seems mad...
15111211221122111221211.content:
Miffie mused, woefully, that she herself would make an adequate waterskin by now.

Standing at little more than a foot tall, she and the now-drained stitch of intestines were already on even footing. Of course the skin was designed to contain this much fluid, while Miffies (as well as pixies in general) were ill-equipped to handle the generous amount of water that she had pilfered. Two weeks of gormandizing or not, Miffie was still a short drink of water—

Wrong expression.

After stuffing herself intensely as well as drinking the water dry, Miffie was beginning to find the sack quite roomy. She didn’t dare move around, not with her mother and Mr. Archie out there in the cart, but she had found that the slight movements she could afford were now much easier to accomplish without all those pesky provisions in the way. The pudgy pixie would be content, would be, if she didn’t feel like she was about to explode.

Nestled in a laying position, supported by the natural shape of the cart through the burlap, Miffie sat in silent agony as she battled the beast in her belly. It was so big. So very, very big. And sensitive, her poor tummy was. She had often seen pregnant women in the marketplace, she must have looked like that. One of them, with their swollen orbs of stomachs bobbing in front of them as they walked. The sloshing that echoed from deep inside her stomach made her sick, an awful sensation tensing in the back of her throat. Miffie knew that there was a distinct possibility of vomiting in her near future. But not now, just… not right now, when she was supposed to be hiding.

The paunchy pixie silenced a groan with her free hand, her other one falling to massage the distended dome of her middle. Her skin, pale with a slight shimmer to it, was drawn taut around her stomach. Though she couldn’t quite see it, the tiny breaks in the burlap her only source of light, Miffie’s stomach was quite red. She was in pain. So very, VERY much pain.

Her bright eyes, usually so full of whimsical energy, could only wince as she delicately circled her waterbelly’s tight surface. She bared her teeth, hissing slightly as she drew air in and out. Small tears ran vertically across her face as she fought the urge to cry out for her mother. This may have been the most intense pain she’d felt in her entire life, save for… well, two weeks ago that is…

No! If there was one thing Miffie didn’t need right now, it was images of her exploding…

As she rubbed, her delicate hands seemed to find a sweet spot where the sloshing didn’t hurt quite so much. In an odd, not-really-but-kinda sort of way, it was soothing. The pain didn’t quite melt away, but was rather… transfigured into something a little more bearable. A tickle, but not quite. And only there—the rest of her still ached in misery.

But not bad, right there.

If this was anything like what those pregnant women at the Market had to go through, it would certainly be a long time before Miffie would be proliferating the pixie race!
15111211221122111221211.title: And Not a Drop to Drink

choices: Mother and daughter bond over their eating contest. Miffie confesses.
Kara notices the gossip rags the next day and sees Miffie's interview.
15111211222.content:
An unknown ogre scholar had practically beat down the door to Miffie's home, begging to see Miffie. Kara was about to turn the annoying female ogre into a toad when Miffie had darted outside and spoke with the surprisingly intelligent ogre.

The scholar's name was one Chunka Glorp and she was researching pixies. Since Miffie was the only pixie around for leagues, Chunka decided to call on her. They had set an appointment for this day and Miffie was to meet Chunka at the inn Chunka was staying at.

Idly touching her slightly softer middle, Miffie flew towards the inn after kissing her mother goodbye on the cheek.

Meeting Chunka at the inn diner, Miffie couldn't help but marvel at the sheer size of the female scholar. Sure she knew ogres tended to be on the large side, but Chunka was big even for a normal ogre. Miffie had to dodge a few errant jiggles of Chunka's belly as she interviewed her and once even a bit of food that came flying from the ogress's mouth.

"So you don't know anything about pixie culture then?"

"Only what mother has told me. Pixies tend to be communal rather than individualistic, the well-being of the tribe coming before all else. We have an affinity for magic and are adept at stealth."

"I already knew all that but thank you anyway. Doesn't it bother you, to not know about your own race?"

Miffie shrugged her shoulders. "Not really. Magic is my passion."

"I see...what's it like being the daughter of the Kara Skyrider?"

"How will that help your pixie research?"

"Just answer the question, if you don't mind."

"It's honestly normal, at least, what I've come to see as normal in the world. We have our disagreements and she can certainly be quite the taskmaster at times but she's my mom, that's what it's supposed to be like."

"Do you think you'll be a better mage than she is?"

Miffie's face turned red at that and she shrugged her shoulders again. "Who knows? Mom's been alive for over nine hundred years so she has quite the head-start."

"Well thank you for your time."

"You're welcome and good luck with your studies!"

Chunka nodded at that and watched as Miffie flew away. Once she was certain the pixie was gone, Chunka chuckled deeply. She had gotten some good dirt on Kara Skyrider and her brat of an adopted daughter.

Front page, here I come, the undercover reporter thought.

As Miffie entered her home, she found several cupcakes waiting for her on the table and soon enough felt her mother's magic all around her.

"Welcome home dear. Did the interview go well?"

"It was okay, but she started asking about you towards the end."

Kara's brows furrowed at that but she soon enough shook her head, sitting down at the table and conjuring up quite the large meal for herself and a few more cupcakes for Miffie.

"What's all this for?"

"I decided that I'm done watching my figure for awhile and you've been doing so well with your magic that a big reward was in order."

Miffie nodded at that, guilt flooding her as she watched her pick up her fork, her dark eyes twinkling a bit as she looked at her.

"Bet I can eat more than you."

Miffie forced a grin on her face and picked up a bit of frosting with her hand.

"You're on!"
15111211222.title: A Pixiologist is going to be interviewing Miffi...

choices: Kara and Miffie fight the next day about Liara. Miffie runs away.
Kara is depressed the next day and Miffie can't cheer her up.
1511122.content:
Miffie practiced the spell well into the early hours of the morning, getting the motions down and the energy focus, but not completely casting it just yet. She wanted to test it out to see if it worked correctly. She took her time enjoying the cupcakes, her mother lightly chastising her for getting frosting all over her robes and face, to which Miffie just grinned sheepishly.

For the next few days Miffie did little but fly around, hang out with her friends, and spend time with her mother, until one day, she found a note waiting for her when she got home from a friend's home.

Dear Miffie,

Going out with the Liana Clovus for dinner tonight, your dinner is in the pantry.

Love, Mother.

All of Miffie's anxiety rose to the surface then. Her mother would become enthralled with the baker and leave her alone. No, no, Miffie thought to herself, that can't happen. I won't let it happen. Mother only needs me in her life!

Nodding along with her thoughts, Miffie soon darted out of her home, zipping through town and all the restaurants and taverns, finally finding her mother and Liana at a table for two, a candle between the pair and eating together. Glaring at the woman who was trying to take her mother away from her, Miffie readied her first real casting of Phantus Gustes and aimed it at the baker.

All it took was the sight of Liara's pained face and the baker's hand going to her bloated stomach for Miffie to know that she'd done it right.

Grinning, she dashed home, content with the knowledge that her mother's date was ruined.
1511122.title: Miffie tries it out on someone else first...

choices: Miffie's first day as a baker's apprentince.
Miffie notices her mother is a bit flustered around the elven baker.
1512.content:
Her magic had created a living hunk of cake. It had a gaping chasm for a mouth and a facsimile of two arms and two legs. Miffie gaped at what her magic had created, barely dodging out of the way of a sugary grasp as she flew up into the air.

Charging her magic, Miffie sent a lightning ball straight into the cake golem's chest.

The only thing Miffie got from her attack was a gurgled roar.

More sugary arms grasped for her but she dodged again.

Think, Miffie, think!

Just then, she saw her mother's enchanted sword, a gift from a thankful village populace, and grabbed it, using her magic to grant herself the strength to lift it. Fire shot along the blade's length and Miffie charged with all her might.

Unfortunately, the blade passed right through without doing any serious damage and Miffie was soon caught, helpless in the sticky grip. She opened her mouth to chant a spell but a sugary sludge dripped down her throat, silencing the pixie.

So this is how it ends, Miffie thought. At least it was a tasty way to go.


Suddenly, the cake golem exploded in chunks of batter, chocolate, and frosting, the remains of her terrible creation now nothing but a large mess in the living room.

Her mother was behind the blast, soon cleansing the remains and sending them to the void.

Miffie passed out shortly after that.

When she came to, she found her mother hovering over her, a mug of sweet tea in her hand.

"I'm sorry," Miffie muttered. "I...I understand if you don't want to teach me magic anymore. I've proven myself unfit to be trusted with such power."

Kara's finger found her stomach then and stroked gently.

"Oh Miffie, I'm not going to stop teaching you. My magic is the greatest gift I could give you and I know you'll be a greater mage than I am one day."

Miffie gaped at that.

"It's true," her mother replied, chuckling a bit at the stupefied expression on her daughter's face. "But you do need to learn restraint and more importantly patience. So I think working with the baker will serve you well."

"But mother, she hates me!"

"She doesn't hate you dear. In fact, she offered to take you under her wing ever since the cupcake incident, figuring it would be a good punishment. I didn't agree then but now I'm starting to see the wisdom of her offer."

Miffie hung her head but nodded. "Alright, I'll work for the baker."

Kara smiled warmly and Miffie felt her guilt fade under it. She loved it when her mother was happy with her. It was almost as great as eating sweets.

"Wonderful! I'll contact her in the morning and we'll set up your hours."

154.content:
More character choices! (In the Miffie section because I'm a crappy planner.) Intro chapters coming soon; the option to add more will open up once they're up.

1. Rennie, a bottle gnome alchemist. Bottle gnomes are a race I've submitted to a couple of other stories, and I like them a lot so let's use 'em here, too. And why waste a perfectly good description? Here, from the Bottle Gnome sourcebook:

"A short, inquisitive race of humanoids that lives around the world in isolated valleys, calderas, deep woods, or cavern systems--anywhere they can build their communities while remaining safe from the larger and more dangerous races. Their word for themselves is Gnomae, but they are more frequently known as bottle gnomes, a name given to them by human alchemists due to their curious metabolic traits. The bodies of gnomes are hypersensitive to the magical properties of the natural world, and will often draw out and express hidden alchemical properties in their food. Because of this, gnomes tend to express strange characteristics as they age, everything from growing antlers or tails to changing their color or size dramatically to acquiring bizarre powers and abilities.

Gnomes are often sought by those who seek to exploit this trait, stuffing them full of the proper ingredients and then extracting the result potion as it's produced. Female gnomes are preferred for this purpose, as they can be easily milked to produce a high-quality, nearly pure extract. Due to a pronounced gluttonous streak, gnomes may voluntarily participate in this endeavor if the ingredients are tasty.

Eating large quantities of ordinary potatoes will render a bottle gnome highly explosive; this is sometimes used in war. Understandably, there are few volunteers for this service."

Rennie herself is a young bottle gnome of modest means who's just been apprenticed to a potentially pervy purveyor of potent potable potions. What lies in store for her?

2. Suggestions are open! Drop me a note with your idea and if it's good, I'll put it here.

choices: Get a batch of health potions going in the cauldron (and Rennie's the cauldron!)
Try a very strange experiment involving a cornucopia of weird ingredients.
Send Rennie out to pick a few things we're low on.
1541.content:
"Who's there?" called a voice from within the alchemist's cottage.

"Rennie!" the young gnome called. "Rennie Poppercork?"

"Rennie Poppercork who?"

Rennie put her hands behind her head. "Rennie Poppercork, your new apprentice? Golly, don't tell me you forgot I was coming!"

The door flew open. "Ah, Rennie Poppercork, of course!" said the slim, dark-haired young man who opened the door. "I almost forgot I was advertising for an, er, for an apprentice." He smiled charmingly. "Come in, come in! Ready to work, I see?"

"Uh-huh!" Rennie nodded. She had on a green tunic, sturdy overalls, tough leather boots and strong gloves. Her chipmunk-brown hair was covered with a broad sunhat, the better to keep any more freckles from forming on her already-freely-freckled face. "My book said that alchemy was five percent inspiration, five percent education, and ninety percent digging stuff up! So... I'm ready to dig stuff up!"

"Good, good!" the alchemist, one Percival the Pourer by name, said cheerfully. "Though you'll find in this line of work your unique, ah, physiological gifts will be far more useful to you than that. If I wanted dirt turned over, I would have taken on an ogre!"

"My wha?"

"All in due time, my dear, all in due time." Percival rubbed his hands together. "I see you've been eating quite a plain diet, haven't you? No antlers, no tail, no scales, no glowing body parts or leaves or feathers."

"Oh no, Master," Rennie said, bowing, "at my house we ate boiled mushroot, mostly."

"The least alchemically active natural substance of all time," Percival said, nodding. "Of course. Well, we'll soon introduce a little variety into your diet, won't we? But it's best to start off this way, oh yes, with the cauldron freshly scrubbed out, so to speak."

"I suppose," Rennie said, not quite sure what he was talking about. All she really knew was that she was expected to help create potions.

"Well, if you're ready to dive right in, my girl," the alchemist said, "I've got an assignment you can help with right now!"
1541.title: Gnock, Gnock!

choices: Way more than she's comfortable with.  Way, way more.
Just one more...but there's a little catch.
15411.content:
Percival guided the young bottle gnome to the laboratory bench and sat her down, taking her floppy sunhat and hanging it on a hook. "This really is perfect timing, I just received a bulk order from the Adventurer's Guild in Wendell; healing potions by the dozen, and as quick as I can manage them. It would have taken forever the conventional way!"

"Healing potions?" Rennie asked thoughtfully. "Those are made of... crimson toadstools and fuff grass, right?"

"Correct!" Pervical said. "Now, we haven't a moment to lose. You've got to get just as much of that stuff as you can manage on the boil right away. I know I laid the ingredients out here somewhere."

"On the boil?"

"You know, start distilling it, down in that wonderful gurgling factory you're currently wrapped around."

"You want me to... eat it?" Rennie asked.

"Goodness, you mean you didn't know? Of course!" Percival said. "That's what bottle gnomes do, after all. Now, you'll need to put away at least a dozen servings of each--"

"O-okay," Rennie said, trying to sound enthusiastic as she watched the heavy bins be set down on the creaking table. Twin mountains of shiny mushrooms and soft grass towered before her. A dozen servings? Of each?

But she was an apprentice, after all, and apprentices did what they were told, even when their stomachs felt funny at the very thought.

"Make sure you alternate bites!" Pervical told her as she began working on the food. "We want it nice and mixed in."

"I'b doid'--" she swallowed, "--I'm doing my best, Master!"

She went back and forth, back and forth, until she'd eaten so many bites she lost count.

"All right, Rennie, stop eating," Percival said.

"Thank. Goodness!" Rennie sighed, pushing herself away from the table and patting her stomach. "I'm stuffed!"

"Well, this break will do you good, then," the alchemist observed. "We need to mix up what's in there; how about a jog around the room?"

"Ohh. Oh, I couldn't possibly--"

"Rennie, this is quite important for aerating the potion. Five laps should do it, I think."

Stifling a groan, Rennie slid out of her chair and started on a circuit of the cottage. It wasn't a big room, but her short legs and full belly made running a real chore. By the third lap she was breathing hard, and by the fourth, a nasty stitch was stinging her along the short length of her side. Finishing the fifth, she hauled herself back into the chair and released a loud, cathartic belch.

"Wonderful! Get that air our of your system," Percival said, clapping. "Now we're ready for the second layer!"

The second layer? Rennie thought in alarm as her new master slid the bins of ingredients back up toward her. H-how many are there going to be?
15411.title: Gnot What I Expected

choices: "The batch should be perfect!"
"There's something... Off."
154112.content:
There were three containers. The two normal mushroom bins, and a pitcher that looked like it was filled with syrup.

"Ah, yes. That'll be for taste and texture. You'll be downing it after your second jog. Bon appetit!"

Moaning, she sat back down, wincing as her stomach pressed up against the table. It was beginning to get drum-taut with ingredients, as she set back to emptying the bins. "Blurghh..." The mountains were slowly worn down by her steady grazing, until finally they vanished, leaving nothing but a pitcher of syrup and a green-faced gnome. "I... I think I'm gonna be sick..."

"No, no! Then you'll have to do it all over again! Just take a little jaunt around the room, you'll feel fine!" Groaning, she did as she was told, her massive, overstretched belly sloshing and bouncing as she did lap after lap, sweat running down her body as she finished. "Huff... Huff... BRAAAAAAAAAPH. Wugh. I'm... I'm..." She looked to the pitcher. "I'm not done yet, I guess..."

"Not quite! It's the home stretch, Rennie! Just open your mouth, tilt your head back, and think happy thoughts!"

Percival took the pitcher in hand as the hapless bottle gnome did as she was told, then poured the syrup down her throat. It was... Well, actually, it was oddly pleasant. It tasted nice, and she could feel it warming her body and tingling through her fingers. It still took up a lot of space in her stomach, though... After this, she didn't think she'd be able to fit anything else in without a tamping rod being jammed down her throat. Finally, the sweetish trickle of syrup stopped, and the bottle gnome was left to recline on her chair, when she suddenly felt the alchemist's fingers kneading around her stomach. Blushing, but too stuffed full of food to really protest, she settled for an apprehensive gurgle.

"Merely some final ministrations, to see how it's forming... Hmmm... Hmmm...." He patted her stomach like a drum, flicked it a few times... Once she even thought she could feel him LICKING her belly button. "Hmmmm... Well..."
154112.title: Gnowing Your Limits

Rennie decides to deliver the potions herself and work off a couple of pounds.
1541121.content:
"Now it just needs to ferment for a few hours," Percival continued. "You're free until then; just mind you don't eat anything else, or it will throw off the mixture."

Rennie moaned. Eat anything else? The very idea filled her with horror.

Stuffed to such repletion that she could scarcely move, she dozed on and off in the chair as the sun sank from its zenith to the horizon. She woke around nightfall, blinking with the strange confusion of the late-afternoon napper. She felt better, now--much less uncomfortable--but the stuffed feeling in her middle had given way to an overall sensation of bloating. Her breasts felt tender and swollen, pushing against the shoulder straps of her overalls. She squirmed.

"Ah, looks like you're ready!" the alchemist exclaimed. "Let's get started on that order."

He pulled a vial from his sleeve and approached Rennie, pulling her shirt down and pressing the vial against the nipple. She gasped from the sudden fell of cold glass against her sensitive skin. Then Percival began expertly kneading, forcing a thin stream of red liquid from the nipple. He continued the process, filling first one vial, then another, then another, all the while taking frequent breaks to give swigs from a pitcher of water. "Must stay hydrated," he explained.

Rennie didn't mind; with every filled vial she felt a little more relief as the pressure on her middle eased up. When Percival had filled a dozen vials, he stopped.

"That's all for today."

"Are...are you sure?," Rennie said, red-faced and sweating. "I-I still feel a little...full."

"Not every bit of the ingredients is broken down; you still have to digest those in the normal way.

"Ah," Rennie laughed nervously. "Golly! I sure hope I don't get fat!"

"Nonsense! The bigger the better, my dear. We must step up production, after all!"

"Oh." Rennie looked down at the small pot belly rounding out her overalls and sighed. "Goodie."

2) Avoid scat, exploding, children being involved in anything sexual or fetishy, non-food/drink related inflation, male WG, immobility, death of the main characters, or excessive slobbiness. Given that some of them are rather monstrous, vore may make an appearance, but please don't get too graphic.

If you follow these and make your addition a decent length, I'll do my best to follow up any additions (eventually!) Have fun!
